3797 static void collectMapDataFromMapOperands(
3798  MapInfoData &mapData, SmallVectorImpl<Value> &mapVars,
3799  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation, DataLayout &dl,
3800  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder, ArrayRef<Value> useDevPtrOperands = {},
3801  ArrayRef<Value> useDevAddrOperands = {},
3802  ArrayRef<Value> hasDevAddrOperands = {}) {
3803  auto checkIsAMember = [](const auto &mapVars, auto mapOp) {
3804  // Check if this is a member mapping and correctly assign that it is, if
3805  // it is a member of a larger object.
3806  // TODO: Need better handling of members, and distinguishing of members
3807  // that are implicitly allocated on device vs explicitly passed in as
3808  // arguments.
3809  // TODO: May require some further additions to support nested record
3810  // types, i.e. member maps that can have member maps.
3811  for (Value mapValue : mapVars) {
3812  auto map = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapValue.getDefiningOp());
3813  for (auto member : map.getMembers())
3814  if (member == mapOp)
3815  return true;
3816  }
3817  return false;
3818  };
3819 
3820  // Process MapOperands
3821  for (Value mapValue : mapVars) {
3822  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapValue.getDefiningOp());
3823  Value offloadPtr =
3824  mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() ? mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() : mapOp.getVarPtr();
3825  mapData.OriginalValue.push_back(moduleTranslation.lookupValue(offloadPtr));
3826  mapData.Pointers.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue.back());
3827 
3828  if (llvm::Value *refPtr =
3829  getRefPtrIfDeclareTarget(offloadPtr,
3830  moduleTranslation)) { // declare target
3831  mapData.IsDeclareTarget.push_back(true);
3832  mapData.BasePointers.push_back(refPtr);
3833  } else { // regular mapped variable
3834  mapData.IsDeclareTarget.push_back(false);
3835  mapData.BasePointers.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue.back());
3836  }
3837 
3838  mapData.BaseType.push_back(
3839  moduleTranslation.convertType(mapOp.getVarType()));
3840  mapData.Sizes.push_back(
3841  getSizeInBytes(dl, mapOp.getVarType(), mapOp, mapData.Pointers.back(),
3842  mapData.BaseType.back(), builder, moduleTranslation));
3843  mapData.MapClause.push_back(mapOp.getOperation());
3844  mapData.Types.push_back(
3845  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags(mapOp.getMapType()));
3846  mapData.Names.push_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
3847  mapOp.getLoc(), *moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()));
3848  mapData.DevicePointers.push_back(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::None);
3849  if (mapOp.getMapperId())
3850  mapData.Mappers.push_back(
3851  SymbolTable::lookupNearestSymbolFrom<omp::DeclareMapperOp>(
3852  mapOp, mapOp.getMapperIdAttr()));
3853  else
3854  mapData.Mappers.push_back(nullptr);
3855  mapData.IsAMapping.push_back(true);
3856  mapData.IsAMember.push_back(checkIsAMember(mapVars, mapOp));
3857  }
3858 
3859  auto findMapInfo = [&mapData](llvm::Value *val,
3860  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy devInfoTy) {
3861  unsigned index = 0;
3862  bool found = false;
3863  for (llvm::Value *basePtr : mapData.OriginalValue) {
3864  if (basePtr == val && mapData.IsAMapping[index]) {
3865  found = true;
3866  mapData.Types[index] |=
3867  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_RETURN_PARAM;
3868  mapData.DevicePointers[index] = devInfoTy;
3869  }
3870  index++;
3871  }
3872  return found;
3873  };
3874 
3875  // Process useDevPtr(Addr)Operands
3876  auto addDevInfos = [&](const llvm::ArrayRef<Value> &useDevOperands,
3877  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy devInfoTy) {
3878  for (Value mapValue : useDevOperands) {
3879  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapValue.getDefiningOp());
3880  Value offloadPtr =
3881  mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() ? mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() : mapOp.getVarPtr();
3882  llvm::Value *origValue = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(offloadPtr);
3883 
3884  // Check if map info is already present for this entry.
3885  if (!findMapInfo(origValue, devInfoTy)) {
3886  mapData.OriginalValue.push_back(origValue);
3887  mapData.Pointers.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue.back());
3888  mapData.IsDeclareTarget.push_back(false);
3889  mapData.BasePointers.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue.back());
3890  mapData.BaseType.push_back(
3891  moduleTranslation.convertType(mapOp.getVarType()));
3892  mapData.Sizes.push_back(builder.getInt64(0));
3893  mapData.MapClause.push_back(mapOp.getOperation());
3894  mapData.Types.push_back(
3895  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_RETURN_PARAM);
3896  mapData.Names.push_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
3897  mapOp.getLoc(), *moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()));
3898  mapData.DevicePointers.push_back(devInfoTy);
3899  mapData.Mappers.push_back(nullptr);
3900  mapData.IsAMapping.push_back(false);
3901  mapData.IsAMember.push_back(checkIsAMember(useDevOperands, mapOp));
3902  }
3903  }
3904  };
3905 
3906  addDevInfos(useDevAddrOperands, llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address);
3907  addDevInfos(useDevPtrOperands, llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer);
3908 
3909  for (Value mapValue : hasDevAddrOperands) {
3910  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapValue.getDefiningOp());
3911  Value offloadPtr =
3912  mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() ? mapOp.getVarPtrPtr() : mapOp.getVarPtr();
3913  llvm::Value *origValue = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(offloadPtr);
3914  auto mapType =
3915  static_cast<llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags>(mapOp.getMapType());
3916  auto mapTypeAlways = llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_ALWAYS;
3917 
3918  mapData.OriginalValue.push_back(origValue);
3919  mapData.BasePointers.push_back(origValue);
3920  mapData.Pointers.push_back(origValue);
3921  mapData.IsDeclareTarget.push_back(false);
3922  mapData.BaseType.push_back(
3923  moduleTranslation.convertType(mapOp.getVarType()));
3924  mapData.Sizes.push_back(
3925  builder.getInt64(dl.getTypeSize(mapOp.getVarType())));
3926  mapData.MapClause.push_back(mapOp.getOperation());
3927  if (llvm::to_underlying(mapType & mapTypeAlways)) {
3928  // Descriptors are mapped with the ALWAYS flag, since they can get
3929  // rematerialized, so the address of the decriptor for a given object
3930  // may change from one place to another.
3931  mapData.Types.push_back(mapType);
3932  // Technically it's possible for a non-descriptor mapping to have
3933  // both has-device-addr and ALWAYS, so lookup the mapper in case it
3934  // exists.
3935  if (mapOp.getMapperId()) {
3936  mapData.Mappers.push_back(
3937  SymbolTable::lookupNearestSymbolFrom<omp::DeclareMapperOp>(
3938  mapOp, mapOp.getMapperIdAttr()));
3939  } else {
3940  mapData.Mappers.push_back(nullptr);
3941  }
3942  } else {
3943  mapData.Types.push_back(
3944  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_LITERAL);
3945  mapData.Mappers.push_back(nullptr);
3946  }
3947  mapData.Names.push_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
3948  mapOp.getLoc(), *moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()));
3949  mapData.DevicePointers.push_back(
3950  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address);
3951  mapData.IsAMapping.push_back(false);
3952  mapData.IsAMember.push_back(checkIsAMember(hasDevAddrOperands, mapOp));
3953  }
3954 }
3955 
3956 static int getMapDataMemberIdx(MapInfoData &mapData, omp::MapInfoOp memberOp) {
3957  auto *res = llvm::find(mapData.MapClause, memberOp);
3958  assert(res != mapData.MapClause.end() &&
3959  "MapInfoOp for member not found in MapData, cannot return index");
3960  return std::distance(mapData.MapClause.begin(), res);
3961 }
3962 
3963 static omp::MapInfoOp getFirstOrLastMappedMemberPtr(omp::MapInfoOp mapInfo,
3964  bool first) {
3965  ArrayAttr indexAttr = mapInfo.getMembersIndexAttr();
3966  // Only 1 member has been mapped, we can return it.
3967  if (indexAttr.size() == 1)
3968  return cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapInfo.getMembers()[0].getDefiningOp());
3969 
3970  llvm::SmallVector<size_t> indices(indexAttr.size());
3971  std::iota(indices.begin(), indices.end(), 0);
3972 
3973  llvm::sort(indices, [&](const size_t a, const size_t b) {
3974  auto memberIndicesA = cast<ArrayAttr>(indexAttr[a]);
3975  auto memberIndicesB = cast<ArrayAttr>(indexAttr[b]);
3976  for (const auto it : llvm::zip(memberIndicesA, memberIndicesB)) {
3977  int64_t aIndex = cast<IntegerAttr>(std::get<0>(it)).getInt();
3978  int64_t bIndex = cast<IntegerAttr>(std::get<1>(it)).getInt();
3979 
3980  if (aIndex == bIndex)
3981  continue;
3982 
3983  if (aIndex < bIndex)
3984  return first;
3985 
3986  if (aIndex > bIndex)
3987  return !first;
3988  }
3989 
3990  // Iterated the up until the end of the smallest member and
3991  // they were found to be equal up to that point, so select
3992  // the member with the lowest index count, so the "parent"
3993  return memberIndicesA.size() < memberIndicesB.size();
3994  });
3995 
3996  return llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(
3997  mapInfo.getMembers()[indices.front()].getDefiningOp());
3998 }
3999 
4000 /// This function calculates the array/pointer offset for map data provided
4001 /// with bounds operations, e.g. when provided something like the following:
4002 ///
4003 /// Fortran
4004 /// map(tofrom: array(2:5, 3:2))
4005 /// or
4006 /// C++
4007 /// map(tofrom: array[1:4][2:3])
4008 /// We must calculate the initial pointer offset to pass across, this function
4009 /// performs this using bounds.
4010 ///
4011 /// NOTE: which while specified in row-major order it currently needs to be
4012 /// flipped for Fortran's column order array allocation and access (as
4013 /// opposed to C++'s row-major, hence the backwards processing where order is
4014 /// important). This is likely important to keep in mind for the future when
4015 /// we incorporate a C++ frontend, both frontends will need to agree on the
4016 /// ordering of generated bounds operations (one may have to flip them) to
4017 /// make the below lowering frontend agnostic. The offload size
4018 /// calcualtion may also have to be adjusted for C++.
4019 static std::vector<llvm::Value *>
4020 calculateBoundsOffset(LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4021  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder, bool isArrayTy,
4022  OperandRange bounds) {
4023  std::vector<llvm::Value *> idx;
4024  // There's no bounds to calculate an offset from, we can safely
4025  // ignore and return no indices.
4026  if (bounds.empty())
4027  return idx;
4028 
4029  // If we have an array type, then we have its type so can treat it as a
4030  // normal GEP instruction where the bounds operations are simply indexes
4031  // into the array. We currently do reverse order of the bounds, which
4032  // I believe leans more towards Fortran's column-major in memory.
4033  if (isArrayTy) {
4034  idx.push_back(builder.getInt64(0));
4035  for (int i = bounds.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
4036  if (auto boundOp = dyn_cast_if_present<omp::MapBoundsOp>(
4037  bounds[i].getDefiningOp())) {
4038  idx.push_back(moduleTranslation.lookupValue(boundOp.getLowerBound()));
4039  }
4040  }
4041  } else {
4042  // If we do not have an array type, but we have bounds, then we're dealing
4043  // with a pointer that's being treated like an array and we have the
4044  // underlying type e.g. an i32, or f64 etc, e.g. a fortran descriptor base
4045  // address (pointer pointing to the actual data) so we must caclulate the
4046  // offset using a single index which the following two loops attempts to
4047  // compute.
4048 
4049  // Calculates the size offset we need to make per row e.g. first row or
4050  // column only needs to be offset by one, but the next would have to be
4051  // the previous row/column offset multiplied by the extent of current row.
4052  //
4053  // For example ([1][10][100]):
4054  //
4055  // - First row/column we move by 1 for each index increment
4056  // - Second row/column we move by 1 (first row/column) * 10 (extent/size of
4057  // current) for 10 for each index increment
4058  // - Third row/column we would move by 10 (second row/column) *
4059  // (extent/size of current) 100 for 1000 for each index increment
4060  std::vector<llvm::Value *> dimensionIndexSizeOffset{builder.getInt64(1)};
4061  for (size_t i = 1; i < bounds.size(); ++i) {
4062  if (auto boundOp = dyn_cast_if_present<omp::MapBoundsOp>(
4063  bounds[i].getDefiningOp())) {
4064  dimensionIndexSizeOffset.push_back(builder.CreateMul(
4065  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(boundOp.getExtent()),
4066  dimensionIndexSizeOffset[i - 1]));
4067  }
4068  }
4069 
4070  // Now that we have calculated how much we move by per index, we must
4071  // multiply each lower bound offset in indexes by the size offset we
4072  // have calculated in the previous and accumulate the results to get
4073  // our final resulting offset.
4074  for (int i = bounds.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
4075  if (auto boundOp = dyn_cast_if_present<omp::MapBoundsOp>(
4076  bounds[i].getDefiningOp())) {
4077  if (idx.empty())
4078  idx.emplace_back(builder.CreateMul(
4079  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(boundOp.getLowerBound()),
4080  dimensionIndexSizeOffset[i]));
4081  else
4082  idx.back() = builder.CreateAdd(
4083  idx.back(), builder.CreateMul(moduleTranslation.lookupValue(
4084  boundOp.getLowerBound()),
4085  dimensionIndexSizeOffset[i]));
4086  }
4087  }
4088  }
4089 
4090  return idx;
4091 }
4092 
4093 // This creates two insertions into the MapInfosTy data structure for the
4094 // "parent" of a set of members, (usually a container e.g.
4095 // class/structure/derived type) when subsequent members have also been
4096 // explicitly mapped on the same map clause. Certain types, such as Fortran
4097 // descriptors are mapped like this as well, however, the members are
4098 // implicit as far as a user is concerned, but we must explicitly map them
4099 // internally.
4100 //
4101 // This function also returns the memberOfFlag for this particular parent,
4102 // which is utilised in subsequent member mappings (by modifying there map type
4103 // with it) to indicate that a member is part of this parent and should be
4104 // treated by the runtime as such. Important to achieve the correct mapping.
4105 //
4106 // This function borrows a lot from Clang's emitCombinedEntry function
4107 // inside of CGOpenMPRuntime.cpp
4108 static llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags mapParentWithMembers(
4109  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4110  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder, DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4111  MapInfoData &mapData, uint64_t mapDataIndex, bool isTargetParams) {
4112  assert(!ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4113  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4114 
4115  // Map the first segment of the parent. If a user-defined mapper is attached,
4116  // include the parent's to/from-style bits (and common modifiers) in this
4117  // base entry so the mapper receives correct copy semantics via its 'type'
4118  // parameter. Also keep TARGET_PARAM when required for kernel arguments.
4119  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags baseFlag =
4120  isTargetParams
4121  ? llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM
4122  : llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_NONE;
4123 
4124  // Detect if this mapping uses a user-defined mapper.
4125  bool hasUserMapper = mapData.Mappers[mapDataIndex] != nullptr;
4126  if (hasUserMapper) {
4127  using mapFlags = llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags;
4128  // Preserve relevant map-type bits from the parent clause. These include
4129  // the copy direction (TO/FROM), as well as commonly used modifiers that
4130  // should be visible to the mapper for correct behaviour.
4131  mapFlags parentFlags = mapData.Types[mapDataIndex];
4132  mapFlags preserve = mapFlags::OMP_MAP_TO | mapFlags::OMP_MAP_FROM |
4133  mapFlags::OMP_MAP_ALWAYS | mapFlags::OMP_MAP_CLOSE |
4134  mapFlags::OMP_MAP_PRESENT | mapFlags::OMP_MAP_OMPX_HOLD;
4135  baseFlag |= (parentFlags & preserve);
4136  }
4137 
4138  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(baseFlag);
4139  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4140  mapData.DevicePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4141  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(mapData.Mappers[mapDataIndex]);
4142  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
4143  mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]->getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4144  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4145 
4146  // Calculate size of the parent object being mapped based on the
4147  // addresses at runtime, highAddr - lowAddr = size. This of course
4148  // doesn't factor in allocated data like pointers, hence the further
4149  // processing of members specified by users, or in the case of
4150  // Fortran pointers and allocatables, the mapping of the pointed to
4151  // data by the descriptor (which itself, is a structure containing
4152  // runtime information on the dynamically allocated data).
4153  auto parentClause =
4154  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4155 
4156  llvm::Value *lowAddr, *highAddr;
4157  if (!parentClause.getPartialMap()) {
4158  lowAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex],
4159  builder.getPtrTy());
4160  highAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(
4161  builder.CreateConstGEP1_32(mapData.BaseType[mapDataIndex],
4162  mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex], 1),
4163  builder.getPtrTy());
4164  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex]);
4165  } else {
4166  auto mapOp = dyn_cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4167  int firstMemberIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(
4168  mapData, getFirstOrLastMappedMemberPtr(mapOp, true));
4169  lowAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(mapData.Pointers[firstMemberIdx],
4170  builder.getPtrTy());
4171  int lastMemberIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(
4172  mapData, getFirstOrLastMappedMemberPtr(mapOp, false));
4173  highAddr = builder.CreatePointerCast(
4174  builder.CreateGEP(mapData.BaseType[lastMemberIdx],
4175  mapData.Pointers[lastMemberIdx], builder.getInt64(1)),
4176  builder.getPtrTy());
4177  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[firstMemberIdx]);
4178  }
4179 
4180  llvm::Value *size = builder.CreateIntCast(
4181  builder.CreatePtrDiff(builder.getInt8Ty(), highAddr, lowAddr),
4182  builder.getInt64Ty(),
4183  /*isSigned=*/false);
4184  combinedInfo.Sizes.push_back(size);
4185 
4186  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags memberOfFlag =
4187  ompBuilder.getMemberOfFlag(combinedInfo.BasePointers.size() - 1);
4188 
4189  // This creates the initial MEMBER_OF mapping that consists of
4190  // the parent/top level container (same as above effectively, except
4191  // with a fixed initial compile time size and separate maptype which
4192  // indicates the true mape type (tofrom etc.). This parent mapping is
4193  // only relevant if the structure in its totality is being mapped,
4194  // otherwise the above suffices.
4195  if (!parentClause.getPartialMap()) {
4196  // TODO: This will need to be expanded to include the whole host of logic
4197  // for the map flags that Clang currently supports (e.g. it should do some
4198  // further case specific flag modifications). For the moment, it handles
4199  // what we support as expected.
4200  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags mapFlag = mapData.Types[mapDataIndex];
4201  ompBuilder.setCorrectMemberOfFlag(mapFlag, memberOfFlag);
4202  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4203  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4204  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::None);
4205  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(nullptr);
4206  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(LLVM::createMappingInformation(
4207  mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]->getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4208  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4209  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIndex]);
4210  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(mapData.Sizes[mapDataIndex]);
4211  }
4212  return memberOfFlag;
4213 }
4214 
4215 // The intent is to verify if the mapped data being passed is a
4216 // pointer -> pointee that requires special handling in certain cases,
4217 // e.g. applying the OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ map type.
4218 //
4219 // There may be a better way to verify this, but unfortunately with
4220 // opaque pointers we lose the ability to easily check if something is
4221 // a pointer whilst maintaining access to the underlying type.
4222 static bool checkIfPointerMap(omp::MapInfoOp mapOp) {
4223  // If we have a varPtrPtr field assigned then the underlying type is a pointer
4224  if (mapOp.getVarPtrPtr())
4225  return true;
4226 
4227  // If the map data is declare target with a link clause, then it's represented
4228  // as a pointer when we lower it to LLVM-IR even if at the MLIR level it has
4229  // no relation to pointers.
4230  if (isDeclareTargetLink(mapOp.getVarPtr()))
4231  return true;
4232 
4233  return false;
4234 }
4235 
4236 // This function is intended to add explicit mappings of members
4237 static void processMapMembersWithParent(
4238  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4239  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder, DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4240  MapInfoData &mapData, uint64_t mapDataIndex,
4241  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags memberOfFlag) {
4242  assert(!ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4243  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4244 
4245  auto parentClause =
4246  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4247 
4248  for (auto mappedMembers : parentClause.getMembers()) {
4249  auto memberClause =
4250  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mappedMembers.getDefiningOp());
4251  int memberDataIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(mapData, memberClause);
4252 
4253  assert(memberDataIdx >= 0 && "could not find mapped member of structure");
4254 
4255  // If we're currently mapping a pointer to a block of data, we must
4256  // initially map the pointer, and then attatch/bind the data with a
4257  // subsequent map to the pointer. This segment of code generates the
4258  // pointer mapping, which can in certain cases be optimised out as Clang
4259  // currently does in its lowering. However, for the moment we do not do so,
4260  // in part as we currently have substantially less information on the data
4261  // being mapped at this stage.
4262  if (checkIfPointerMap(memberClause)) {
4263  auto mapFlag =
4264  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags(memberClause.getMapType());
4265  mapFlag &= ~llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM;
4266  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_MEMBER_OF;
4267  ompBuilder.setCorrectMemberOfFlag(mapFlag, memberOfFlag);
4268  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4269  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4270  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::None);
4271  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(nullptr);
4272  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(
4273  LLVM::createMappingInformation(memberClause.getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4274  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(
4275  mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIndex]);
4276  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[memberDataIdx]);
4277  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(builder.getInt64(
4278  moduleTranslation.getLLVMModule()->getDataLayout().getPointerSize()));
4279  }
4280 
4281  // Same MemberOfFlag to indicate its link with parent and other members
4282  // of.
4283  auto mapFlag =
4284  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags(memberClause.getMapType());
4285  mapFlag &= ~llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM;
4286  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_MEMBER_OF;
4287  ompBuilder.setCorrectMemberOfFlag(mapFlag, memberOfFlag);
4288  if (checkIfPointerMap(memberClause))
4289  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ;
4290 
4291  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4292  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(
4293  mapData.DevicePointers[memberDataIdx]);
4294  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(mapData.Mappers[memberDataIdx]);
4295  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(
4296  LLVM::createMappingInformation(memberClause.getLoc(), ompBuilder));
4297  uint64_t basePointerIndex =
4298  checkIfPointerMap(memberClause) ? memberDataIdx : mapDataIndex;
4299  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(
4300  mapData.BasePointers[basePointerIndex]);
4301  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[memberDataIdx]);
4302 
4303  llvm::Value *size = mapData.Sizes[memberDataIdx];
4304  if (checkIfPointerMap(memberClause)) {
4305  size = builder.CreateSelect(
4306  builder.CreateIsNull(mapData.Pointers[memberDataIdx]),
4307  builder.getInt64(0), size);
4308  }
4309 
4310  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(size);
4311  }
4312 }
4313 
4314 static void processIndividualMap(MapInfoData &mapData, size_t mapDataIdx,
4315  MapInfosTy &combinedInfo, bool isTargetParams,
4316  int mapDataParentIdx = -1) {
4317  // Declare Target Mappings are excluded from being marked as
4318  // OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM as they are not passed as parameters, they're
4319  // marked with OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ instead.
4320  auto mapFlag = mapData.Types[mapDataIdx];
4321  auto mapInfoOp = llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIdx]);
4322 
4323  bool isPtrTy = checkIfPointerMap(mapInfoOp);
4324  if (isPtrTy)
4325  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_PTR_AND_OBJ;
4326 
4327  if (isTargetParams && !mapData.IsDeclareTarget[mapDataIdx])
4328  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_TARGET_PARAM;
4329 
4330  if (mapInfoOp.getMapCaptureType() == omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByCopy &&
4331  !isPtrTy)
4332  mapFlag |= llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags::OMP_MAP_LITERAL;
4333 
4334  // if we're provided a mapDataParentIdx, then the data being mapped is
4335  // part of a larger object (in a parent <-> member mapping) and in this
4336  // case our BasePointer should be the parent.
4337  if (mapDataParentIdx >= 0)
4338  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(
4339  mapData.BasePointers[mapDataParentIdx]);
4340  else
4341  combinedInfo.BasePointers.emplace_back(mapData.BasePointers[mapDataIdx]);
4342 
4343  combinedInfo.Pointers.emplace_back(mapData.Pointers[mapDataIdx]);
4344  combinedInfo.DevicePointers.emplace_back(mapData.DevicePointers[mapDataIdx]);
4345  combinedInfo.Mappers.emplace_back(mapData.Mappers[mapDataIdx]);
4346  combinedInfo.Names.emplace_back(mapData.Names[mapDataIdx]);
4347  combinedInfo.Types.emplace_back(mapFlag);
4348  combinedInfo.Sizes.emplace_back(mapData.Sizes[mapDataIdx]);
4349 }
4350 
4351 static void processMapWithMembersOf(LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4352  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4353  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder,
4354  DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4355  MapInfoData &mapData, uint64_t mapDataIndex,
4356  bool isTargetParams) {
4357  assert(!ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4358  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4359 
4360  auto parentClause =
4361  llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[mapDataIndex]);
4362 
4363  // If we have a partial map (no parent referenced in the map clauses of the
4364  // directive, only members) and only a single member, we do not need to bind
4365  // the map of the member to the parent, we can pass the member separately.
4366  if (parentClause.getMembers().size() == 1 && parentClause.getPartialMap()) {
4367  auto memberClause = llvm::cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(
4368  parentClause.getMembers()[0].getDefiningOp());
4369  int memberDataIdx = getMapDataMemberIdx(mapData, memberClause);
4370  // Note: Clang treats arrays with explicit bounds that fall into this
4371  // category as a parent with map case, however, it seems this isn't a
4372  // requirement, and processing them as an individual map is fine. So,
4373  // we will handle them as individual maps for the moment, as it's
4374  // difficult for us to check this as we always require bounds to be
4375  // specified currently and it's also marginally more optimal (single
4376  // map rather than two). The difference may come from the fact that
4377  // Clang maps array without bounds as pointers (which we do not
4378  // currently do), whereas we treat them as arrays in all cases
4379  // currently.
4380  processIndividualMap(mapData, memberDataIdx, combinedInfo, isTargetParams,
4381  mapDataIndex);
4382  return;
4383  }
4384 
4385  llvm::omp::OpenMPOffloadMappingFlags memberOfParentFlag =
4386  mapParentWithMembers(moduleTranslation, builder, ompBuilder, dl,
4387  combinedInfo, mapData, mapDataIndex, isTargetParams);
4388  processMapMembersWithParent(moduleTranslation, builder, ompBuilder, dl,
4389  combinedInfo, mapData, mapDataIndex,
4390  memberOfParentFlag);
4391 }
4392 
4393 // This is a variation on Clang's GenerateOpenMPCapturedVars, which
4394 // generates different operation (e.g. load/store) combinations for
4395 // arguments to the kernel, based on map capture kinds which are then
4396 // utilised in the combinedInfo in place of the original Map value.
4397 static void
4398 createAlteredByCaptureMap(MapInfoData &mapData,
4399  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4400  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder) {
4401  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4402  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4403  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i) {
4404  // if it's declare target, skip it, it's handled separately.
4405  if (!mapData.IsDeclareTarget[i]) {
4406  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[i]);
4407  omp::VariableCaptureKind captureKind = mapOp.getMapCaptureType();
4408  bool isPtrTy = checkIfPointerMap(mapOp);
4409 
4410  // Currently handles array sectioning lowerbound case, but more
4411  // logic may be required in the future. Clang invokes EmitLValue,
4412  // which has specialised logic for special Clang types such as user
4413  // defines, so it is possible we will have to extend this for
4414  // structures or other complex types. As the general idea is that this
4415  // function mimics some of the logic from Clang that we require for
4416  // kernel argument passing from host -> device.
4417  switch (captureKind) {
4418  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByRef: {
4419  llvm::Value *newV = mapData.Pointers[i];
4420  std::vector<llvm::Value *> offsetIdx = calculateBoundsOffset(
4421  moduleTranslation, builder, mapData.BaseType[i]->isArrayTy(),
4422  mapOp.getBounds());
4423  if (isPtrTy)
4424  newV = builder.CreateLoad(builder.getPtrTy(), newV);
4425 
4426  if (!offsetIdx.empty())
4427  newV = builder.CreateInBoundsGEP(mapData.BaseType[i], newV, offsetIdx,
4428  "array_offset");
4429  mapData.Pointers[i] = newV;
4430  } break;
4431  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByCopy: {
4432  llvm::Type *type = mapData.BaseType[i];
4433  llvm::Value *newV;
4434  if (mapData.Pointers[i]->getType()->isPointerTy())
4435  newV = builder.CreateLoad(type, mapData.Pointers[i]);
4436  else
4437  newV = mapData.Pointers[i];
4438 
4439  if (!isPtrTy) {
4440  auto curInsert = builder.saveIP();
4441  llvm::DebugLoc DbgLoc = builder.getCurrentDebugLocation();
4442  builder.restoreIP(findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation));
4443  auto *memTempAlloc =
4444  builder.CreateAlloca(builder.getPtrTy(), nullptr, ".casted");
4445  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(DbgLoc);
4446  builder.restoreIP(curInsert);
4447 
4448  builder.CreateStore(newV, memTempAlloc);
4449  newV = builder.CreateLoad(builder.getPtrTy(), memTempAlloc);
4450  }
4451 
4452  mapData.Pointers[i] = newV;
4453  mapData.BasePointers[i] = newV;
4454  } break;
4455  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::This:
4456  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::VLAType:
4457  mapData.MapClause[i]->emitOpError("Unhandled capture kind");
4458  break;
4459  }
4460  }
4461  }
4462 }
4463 
4464 // Generate all map related information and fill the combinedInfo.
4465 static void genMapInfos(llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4466  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4467  DataLayout &dl, MapInfosTy &combinedInfo,
4468  MapInfoData &mapData, bool isTargetParams = false) {
4469  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4470  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4471 
4472  // We wish to modify some of the methods in which arguments are
4473  // passed based on their capture type by the target region, this can
4474  // involve generating new loads and stores, which changes the
4475  // MLIR value to LLVM value mapping, however, we only wish to do this
4476  // locally for the current function/target and also avoid altering
4477  // ModuleTranslation, so we remap the base pointer or pointer stored
4478  // in the map infos corresponding MapInfoData, which is later accessed
4479  // by genMapInfos and createTarget to help generate the kernel and
4480  // kernel arg structure. It primarily becomes relevant in cases like
4481  // bycopy, or byref range'd arrays. In the default case, we simply
4482  // pass thee pointer byref as both basePointer and pointer.
4483  createAlteredByCaptureMap(mapData, moduleTranslation, builder);
4484 
4485  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4486 
4487  // We operate under the assumption that all vectors that are
4488  // required in MapInfoData are of equal lengths (either filled with
4489  // default constructed data or appropiate information) so we can
4490  // utilise the size from any component of MapInfoData, if we can't
4491  // something is missing from the initial MapInfoData construction.
4492  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i) {
4493  // NOTE/TODO: We currently do not support arbitrary depth record
4494  // type mapping.
4495  if (mapData.IsAMember[i])
4496  continue;
4497 
4498  auto mapInfoOp = dyn_cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[i]);
4499  if (!mapInfoOp.getMembers().empty()) {
4500  processMapWithMembersOf(moduleTranslation, builder, *ompBuilder, dl,
4501  combinedInfo, mapData, i, isTargetParams);
4502  continue;
4503  }
4504 
4505  processIndividualMap(mapData, i, combinedInfo, isTargetParams);
4506  }
4507 }
4508 
4509 static llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *>
4510 emitUserDefinedMapper(Operation *declMapperOp, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4511  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4512  llvm::StringRef mapperFuncName);
4513 
4514 static llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *>
4515 getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4516  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4517  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4518  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4519  auto declMapperOp = cast<omp::DeclareMapperOp>(op);
4520  std::string mapperFuncName =
4521  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->createPlatformSpecificName(
4522  {"omp_mapper", declMapperOp.getSymName()});
4523 
4524  if (auto *lookupFunc = moduleTranslation.lookupFunction(mapperFuncName))
4525  return lookupFunc;
4526 
4527  return emitUserDefinedMapper(declMapperOp, builder, moduleTranslation,
4528  mapperFuncName);
4529 }
4530 
4531 static llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *>
4532 emitUserDefinedMapper(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4533  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
4534  llvm::StringRef mapperFuncName) {
4535  assert(!moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
4536  "function only supported for host device codegen");
4537  auto declMapperOp = cast<omp::DeclareMapperOp>(op);
4538  auto declMapperInfoOp = declMapperOp.getDeclareMapperInfo();
4539  DataLayout dl = DataLayout(declMapperOp->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
4540  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4541  llvm::Type *varType = moduleTranslation.convertType(declMapperOp.getType());
4542  SmallVector<Value> mapVars = declMapperInfoOp.getMapVars();
4543 
4544  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
4545 
4546  // Fill up the arrays with all the mapped variables.
4547  MapInfosTy combinedInfo;
4548  auto genMapInfoCB =
4549  [&](InsertPointTy codeGenIP, llvm::Value *ptrPHI,
4550  llvm::Value *unused2) -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::MapInfosOrErrorTy {
4551  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4552  moduleTranslation.mapValue(declMapperOp.getSymVal(), ptrPHI);
4553  moduleTranslation.mapBlock(&declMapperOp.getRegion().front(),
4554  builder.GetInsertBlock());
4555  if (failed(moduleTranslation.convertBlock(declMapperOp.getRegion().front(),
4556  /*ignoreArguments=*/true,
4557  builder)))
4558  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4559  MapInfoData mapData;
4560  collectMapDataFromMapOperands(mapData, mapVars, moduleTranslation, dl,
4561  builder);
4562  genMapInfos(builder, moduleTranslation, dl, combinedInfo, mapData);
4563 
4564  // Drop the mapping that is no longer necessary so that the same region can
4565  // be processed multiple times.
4566  moduleTranslation.forgetMapping(declMapperOp.getRegion());
4567  return combinedInfo;
4568  };
4569 
4570  auto customMapperCB = [&](unsigned i) -> llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> {
4571  if (!combinedInfo.Mappers[i])
4572  return nullptr;
4573  return getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(combinedInfo.Mappers[i], builder,
4574  moduleTranslation);
4575  };
4576 
4577  llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> newFn = ompBuilder->emitUserDefinedMapper(
4578  genMapInfoCB, varType, mapperFuncName, customMapperCB);
4579  if (!newFn)
4580  return newFn.takeError();
4581  moduleTranslation.mapFunction(mapperFuncName, *newFn);
4582  return *newFn;
4583 }
4584 
4585 static LogicalResult
4586 convertOmpTargetData(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4587  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4588  llvm::Value *ifCond = nullptr;
4589  int64_t deviceID = llvm::omp::OMP_DEVICEID_UNDEF;
4590  SmallVector<Value> mapVars;
4591  SmallVector<Value> useDevicePtrVars;
4592  SmallVector<Value> useDeviceAddrVars;
4593  llvm::omp::RuntimeFunction RTLFn;
4594  DataLayout DL = DataLayout(op->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
4595 
4596  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4597  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetDataInfo info(/*RequiresDevicePointerInfo=*/true,
4598  /*SeparateBeginEndCalls=*/true);
4599  bool isTargetDevice = ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice();
4600  bool isOffloadEntry =
4601  isTargetDevice || !ompBuilder->Config.TargetTriples.empty();
4602 
4603  LogicalResult result =
4604  llvm::TypeSwitch<Operation *, LogicalResult>(op)
4605  .Case([&](omp::TargetDataOp dataOp) {
4606  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*dataOp)))
4607  return failure();
4608 
4609  if (auto ifVar = dataOp.getIfExpr())
4610  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4611 
4612  if (auto devId = dataOp.getDevice())
4613  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4614  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4615  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4616 
4617  mapVars = dataOp.getMapVars();
4618  useDevicePtrVars = dataOp.getUseDevicePtrVars();
4619  useDeviceAddrVars = dataOp.getUseDeviceAddrVars();
4620  return success();
4621  })
4622  .Case([&](omp::TargetEnterDataOp enterDataOp) -> LogicalResult {
4623  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*enterDataOp)))
4624  return failure();
4625 
4626  if (auto ifVar = enterDataOp.getIfExpr())
4627  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4628 
4629  if (auto devId = enterDataOp.getDevice())
4630  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4631  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4632  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4633  RTLFn =
4634  enterDataOp.getNowait()
4635  ? llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_begin_nowait_mapper
4636  : llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_begin_mapper;
4637  mapVars = enterDataOp.getMapVars();
4638  info.HasNoWait = enterDataOp.getNowait();
4639  return success();
4640  })
4641  .Case([&](omp::TargetExitDataOp exitDataOp) -> LogicalResult {
4642  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*exitDataOp)))
4643  return failure();
4644 
4645  if (auto ifVar = exitDataOp.getIfExpr())
4646  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4647 
4648  if (auto devId = exitDataOp.getDevice())
4649  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4650  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4651  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4652 
4653  RTLFn = exitDataOp.getNowait()
4654  ? llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_end_nowait_mapper
4655  : llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_end_mapper;
4656  mapVars = exitDataOp.getMapVars();
4657  info.HasNoWait = exitDataOp.getNowait();
4658  return success();
4659  })
4660  .Case([&](omp::TargetUpdateOp updateDataOp) -> LogicalResult {
4661  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*updateDataOp)))
4662  return failure();
4663 
4664  if (auto ifVar = updateDataOp.getIfExpr())
4665  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(ifVar);
4666 
4667  if (auto devId = updateDataOp.getDevice())
4668  if (auto constOp = devId.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
4669  if (auto intAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
4670  deviceID = intAttr.getInt();
4671 
4672  RTLFn =
4673  updateDataOp.getNowait()
4674  ? llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_update_nowait_mapper
4675  : llvm::omp::OMPRTL___tgt_target_data_update_mapper;
4676  mapVars = updateDataOp.getMapVars();
4677  info.HasNoWait = updateDataOp.getNowait();
4678  return success();
4679  })
4680  .Default([&](Operation *op) {
4681  llvm_unreachable("unexpected operation");
4682  return failure();
4683  });
4684 
4685  if (failed(result))
4686  return failure();
4687  // Pretend we have IF(false) if we're not doing offload.
4688  if (!isOffloadEntry)
4689  ifCond = builder.getFalse();
4690 
4691  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
4692  MapInfoData mapData;
4693  collectMapDataFromMapOperands(mapData, mapVars, moduleTranslation, DL,
4694  builder, useDevicePtrVars, useDeviceAddrVars);
4695 
4696  // Fill up the arrays with all the mapped variables.
4697  MapInfosTy combinedInfo;
4698  auto genMapInfoCB = [&](InsertPointTy codeGenIP) -> MapInfosTy & {
4699  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4700  genMapInfos(builder, moduleTranslation, DL, combinedInfo, mapData);
4701  return combinedInfo;
4702  };
4703 
4704  // Define a lambda to apply mappings between use_device_addr and
4705  // use_device_ptr base pointers, and their associated block arguments.
4706  auto mapUseDevice =
4707  [&moduleTranslation](
4708  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy type,
4709  llvm::ArrayRef<BlockArgument> blockArgs,
4710  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> &useDeviceVars, MapInfoData &mapInfoData,
4711  llvm::function_ref<llvm::Value *(llvm::Value *)> mapper = nullptr) {
4712  for (auto [arg, useDevVar] :
4713  llvm::zip_equal(blockArgs, useDeviceVars)) {
4714 
4715  auto getMapBasePtr = [](omp::MapInfoOp mapInfoOp) {
4716  return mapInfoOp.getVarPtrPtr() ? mapInfoOp.getVarPtrPtr()
4717  : mapInfoOp.getVarPtr();
4718  };
4719 
4720  auto useDevMap = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(useDevVar.getDefiningOp());
4721  for (auto [mapClause, devicePointer, basePointer] : llvm::zip_equal(
4722  mapInfoData.MapClause, mapInfoData.DevicePointers,
4723  mapInfoData.BasePointers)) {
4724  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapClause);
4725  if (getMapBasePtr(mapOp) != getMapBasePtr(useDevMap) ||
4726  devicePointer != type)
4727  continue;
4728 
4729  if (llvm::Value *devPtrInfoMap =
4730  mapper ? mapper(basePointer) : basePointer) {
4731  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, devPtrInfoMap);
4732  break;
4733  }
4734  }
4735  }
4736  };
4737 
4738  using BodyGenTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::BodyGenTy;
4739  auto bodyGenCB = [&](InsertPointTy codeGenIP, BodyGenTy bodyGenType)
4740  -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy {
4741  // We must always restoreIP regardless of doing anything the caller
4742  // does not restore it, leading to incorrect (no) branch generation.
4743  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4744  assert(isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(op) &&
4745  "BodyGen requested for non TargetDataOp");
4746  auto blockArgIface = cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(op);
4747  Region &region = cast<omp::TargetDataOp>(op).getRegion();
4748  switch (bodyGenType) {
4749  case BodyGenTy::Priv:
4750  // Check if any device ptr/addr info is available
4751  if (!info.DevicePtrInfoMap.empty()) {
4752  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address,
4753  blockArgIface.getUseDeviceAddrBlockArgs(),
4754  useDeviceAddrVars, mapData,
4755  [&](llvm::Value *basePointer) -> llvm::Value * {
4756  if (!info.DevicePtrInfoMap[basePointer].second)
4757  return nullptr;
4758  return builder.CreateLoad(
4759  builder.getPtrTy(),
4760  info.DevicePtrInfoMap[basePointer].second);
4761  });
4762  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer,
4763  blockArgIface.getUseDevicePtrBlockArgs(), useDevicePtrVars,
4764  mapData, [&](llvm::Value *basePointer) {
4765  return info.DevicePtrInfoMap[basePointer].second;
4766  });
4767 
4768  if (failed(inlineConvertOmpRegions(region, "omp.data.region", builder,
4769  moduleTranslation)))
4770  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4771  }
4772  break;
4773  case BodyGenTy::DupNoPriv:
4774  if (info.DevicePtrInfoMap.empty()) {
4775  // For host device we still need to do the mapping for codegen,
4776  // otherwise it may try to lookup a missing value.
4777  if (!ompBuilder->Config.IsTargetDevice.value_or(false)) {
4778  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address,
4779  blockArgIface.getUseDeviceAddrBlockArgs(),
4780  useDeviceAddrVars, mapData);
4781  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer,
4782  blockArgIface.getUseDevicePtrBlockArgs(),
4783  useDevicePtrVars, mapData);
4784  }
4785  }
4786  break;
4787  case BodyGenTy::NoPriv:
4788  // If device info is available then region has already been generated
4789  if (info.DevicePtrInfoMap.empty()) {
4790  // For device pass, if use_device_ptr(addr) mappings were present,
4791  // we need to link them here before codegen.
4792  if (ompBuilder->Config.IsTargetDevice.value_or(false)) {
4793  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Address,
4794  blockArgIface.getUseDeviceAddrBlockArgs(),
4795  useDeviceAddrVars, mapData);
4796  mapUseDevice(llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DeviceInfoTy::Pointer,
4797  blockArgIface.getUseDevicePtrBlockArgs(),
4798  useDevicePtrVars, mapData);
4799  }
4800 
4801  if (failed(inlineConvertOmpRegions(region, "omp.data.region", builder,
4802  moduleTranslation)))
4803  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4804  }
4805  break;
4806  }
4807  return builder.saveIP();
4808  };
4809 
4810  auto customMapperCB =
4811  [&](unsigned int i) -> llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> {
4812  if (!combinedInfo.Mappers[i])
4813  return nullptr;
4814  info.HasMapper = true;
4815  return getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(combinedInfo.Mappers[i], builder,
4816  moduleTranslation);
4817  };
4818 
4819  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
4820  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
4821  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
4822  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP = [&]() {
4823  if (isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(op))
4824  return ompBuilder->createTargetData(ompLoc, allocaIP, builder.saveIP(),
4825  builder.getInt64(deviceID), ifCond,
4826  info, genMapInfoCB, customMapperCB,
4827  /*MapperFunc=*/nullptr, bodyGenCB,
4828  /*DeviceAddrCB=*/nullptr);
4829  return ompBuilder->createTargetData(
4830  ompLoc, allocaIP, builder.saveIP(), builder.getInt64(deviceID), ifCond,
4831  info, genMapInfoCB, customMapperCB, &RTLFn);
4832  }();
4833 
4834  if (failed(handleError(afterIP, *op)))
4835  return failure();
4836 
4837  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
4838  return success();
4839 }
4840 
4841 static LogicalResult
4842 convertOmpDistribute(Operation &opInst, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
4843  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4844  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4845  auto distributeOp = cast<omp::DistributeOp>(opInst);
4846  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(opInst)))
4847  return failure();
4848 
4849  /// Process teams op reduction in distribute if the reduction is contained in
4850  /// the distribute op.
4851  omp::TeamsOp teamsOp = opInst.getParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>();
4852  bool doDistributeReduction =
4853  teamsOp ? teamsReductionContainedInDistribute(teamsOp) : false;
4854 
4855  DenseMap<Value, llvm::Value *> reductionVariableMap;
4856  unsigned numReductionVars = teamsOp ? teamsOp.getNumReductionVars() : 0;
4857  SmallVector<omp::DeclareReductionOp> reductionDecls;
4858  SmallVector<llvm::Value *> privateReductionVariables(numReductionVars);
4859  llvm::ArrayRef<bool> isByRef;
4860 
4861  if (doDistributeReduction) {
4862  isByRef = getIsByRef(teamsOp.getReductionByref());
4863  assert(isByRef.size() == teamsOp.getNumReductionVars());
4864 
4865  collectReductionDecls(teamsOp, reductionDecls);
4866  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
4867  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
4868 
4869  MutableArrayRef<BlockArgument> reductionArgs =
4870  llvm::cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(*teamsOp)
4871  .getReductionBlockArgs();
4872 
4873  if (failed(allocAndInitializeReductionVars(
4874  teamsOp, reductionArgs, builder, moduleTranslation, allocaIP,
4875  reductionDecls, privateReductionVariables, reductionVariableMap,
4876  isByRef)))
4877  return failure();
4878  }
4879 
4880  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
4881  auto bodyGenCB = [&](InsertPointTy allocaIP,
4882  InsertPointTy codeGenIP) -> llvm::Error {
4883  // Save the alloca insertion point on ModuleTranslation stack for use in
4884  // nested regions.
4885  LLVM::ModuleTranslation::SaveStack<OpenMPAllocaStackFrame> frame(
4886  moduleTranslation, allocaIP);
4887 
4888  // DistributeOp has only one region associated with it.
4889  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
4890  PrivateVarsInfo privVarsInfo(distributeOp);
4891 
4892  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> afterAllocas =
4893  allocatePrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privVarsInfo, allocaIP);
4894  if (handleError(afterAllocas, opInst).failed())
4895  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4896 
4897  if (handleError(initPrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privVarsInfo),
4898  opInst)
4899  .failed())
4900  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4901 
4902  if (failed(copyFirstPrivateVars(
4903  distributeOp, builder, moduleTranslation, privVarsInfo.mlirVars,
4904  privVarsInfo.llvmVars, privVarsInfo.privatizers,
4905  distributeOp.getPrivateNeedsBarrier())))
4906  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4907 
4908  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4909  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
4910  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> regionBlock =
4911  convertOmpOpRegions(distributeOp.getRegion(), "omp.distribute.region",
4912  builder, moduleTranslation);
4913  if (!regionBlock)
4914  return regionBlock.takeError();
4915  builder.SetInsertPoint(*regionBlock, (*regionBlock)->begin());
4916 
4917  // Skip applying a workshare loop below when translating 'distribute
4918  // parallel do' (it's been already handled by this point while translating
4919  // the nested omp.wsloop).
4920  if (!isa_and_present<omp::WsloopOp>(distributeOp.getNestedWrapper())) {
4921  // TODO: Add support for clauses which are valid for DISTRIBUTE
4922  // constructs. Static schedule is the default.
4923  auto schedule = omp::ClauseScheduleKind::Static;
4924  bool isOrdered = false;
4925  std::optional<omp::ScheduleModifier> scheduleMod;
4926  bool isSimd = false;
4927  llvm::omp::WorksharingLoopType workshareLoopType =
4928  llvm::omp::WorksharingLoopType::DistributeStaticLoop;
4929  bool loopNeedsBarrier = false;
4930  llvm::Value *chunk = nullptr;
4931 
4932  llvm::CanonicalLoopInfo *loopInfo =
4933  findCurrentLoopInfo(moduleTranslation);
4934  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy wsloopIP =
4935  ompBuilder->applyWorkshareLoop(
4936  ompLoc.DL, loopInfo, allocaIP, loopNeedsBarrier,
4937  convertToScheduleKind(schedule), chunk, isSimd,
4938  scheduleMod == omp::ScheduleModifier::monotonic,
4939  scheduleMod == omp::ScheduleModifier::nonmonotonic, isOrdered,
4940  workshareLoopType);
4941 
4942  if (!wsloopIP)
4943  return wsloopIP.takeError();
4944  }
4945 
4946  if (failed(cleanupPrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation,
4947  distributeOp.getLoc(), privVarsInfo.llvmVars,
4948  privVarsInfo.privatizers)))
4949  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
4950 
4951  return llvm::Error::success();
4952  };
4953 
4954  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
4955  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
4956  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
4957  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP =
4958  ompBuilder->createDistribute(ompLoc, allocaIP, bodyGenCB);
4959 
4960  if (failed(handleError(afterIP, opInst)))
4961  return failure();
4962 
4963  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
4964 
4965  if (doDistributeReduction) {
4966  // Process the reductions if required.
4967  return createReductionsAndCleanup(
4968  teamsOp, builder, moduleTranslation, allocaIP, reductionDecls,
4969  privateReductionVariables, isByRef,
4970  /*isNoWait*/ false, /*isTeamsReduction*/ true);
4971  }
4972  return success();
4973 }
4974 
4975 /// Lowers the FlagsAttr which is applied to the module on the device
4976 /// pass when offloading, this attribute contains OpenMP RTL globals that can
4977 /// be passed as flags to the frontend, otherwise they are set to default
4978 static LogicalResult
4979 convertFlagsAttr(Operation *op, mlir::omp::FlagsAttr attribute,
4980  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
4981  if (!cast<mlir::ModuleOp>(op))
4982  return failure();
4983 
4984  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
4985 
4986  ompBuilder->M.addModuleFlag(llvm::Module::Max, "openmp-device",
4987  attribute.getOpenmpDeviceVersion());
4988 
4989  if (attribute.getNoGpuLib())
4990  return success();
4991 
4992  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
4993  attribute.getDebugKind() /*LangOpts().OpenMPTargetDebug*/,
4994  "__omp_rtl_debug_kind");
4995  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
4996  attribute
4997  .getAssumeTeamsOversubscription() /*LangOpts().OpenMPTeamSubscription*/
4998  ,
4999  "__omp_rtl_assume_teams_oversubscription");
5000  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
5001  attribute
5002  .getAssumeThreadsOversubscription() /*LangOpts().OpenMPThreadSubscription*/
5003  ,
5004  "__omp_rtl_assume_threads_oversubscription");
5005  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
5006  attribute.getAssumeNoThreadState() /*LangOpts().OpenMPNoThreadState*/,
5007  "__omp_rtl_assume_no_thread_state");
5008  ompBuilder->createGlobalFlag(
5009  attribute
5010  .getAssumeNoNestedParallelism() /*LangOpts().OpenMPNoNestedParallelism*/
5011  ,
5012  "__omp_rtl_assume_no_nested_parallelism");
5013  return success();
5014 }
5015 
5016 static void getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo &targetInfo,
5017  omp::TargetOp targetOp,
5018  llvm::StringRef parentName = "") {
5019  auto fileLoc = targetOp.getLoc()->findInstanceOf<FileLineColLoc>();
5020 
5021  assert(fileLoc && "No file found from location");
5022  StringRef fileName = fileLoc.getFilename().getValue();
5023 
5024  llvm::sys::fs::UniqueID id;
5025  uint64_t line = fileLoc.getLine();
5026  if (auto ec = llvm::sys::fs::getUniqueID(fileName, id)) {
5027  size_t fileHash = llvm::hash_value(fileName.str());
5028  size_t deviceId = 0xdeadf17e;
5029  targetInfo =
5030  llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo(parentName, deviceId, fileHash, line);
5031  } else {
5032  targetInfo = llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo(parentName, id.getDevice(),
5033  id.getFile(), line);
5034  }
5035 }
5036 
5037 static void
5038 handleDeclareTargetMapVar(MapInfoData &mapData,
5039  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
5040  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder, llvm::Function *func) {
5041  assert(moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
5042  "function only supported for target device codegen");
5043  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPointGuard guard(builder);
5044  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i) {
5045  // In the case of declare target mapped variables, the basePointer is
5046  // the reference pointer generated by the convertDeclareTargetAttr
5047  // method. Whereas the kernelValue is the original variable, so for
5048  // the device we must replace all uses of this original global variable
5049  // (stored in kernelValue) with the reference pointer (stored in
5050  // basePointer for declare target mapped variables), as for device the
5051  // data is mapped into this reference pointer and should be loaded
5052  // from it, the original variable is discarded. On host both exist and
5053  // metadata is generated (elsewhere in the convertDeclareTargetAttr)
5054  // function to link the two variables in the runtime and then both the
5055  // reference pointer and the pointer are assigned in the kernel argument
5056  // structure for the host.
5057  if (mapData.IsDeclareTarget[i]) {
5058  // If the original map value is a constant, then we have to make sure all
5059  // of it's uses within the current kernel/function that we are going to
5060  // rewrite are converted to instructions, as we will be altering the old
5061  // use (OriginalValue) from a constant to an instruction, which will be
5062  // illegal and ICE the compiler if the user is a constant expression of
5063  // some kind e.g. a constant GEP.
5064  if (auto *constant = dyn_cast<llvm::Constant>(mapData.OriginalValue[i]))
5065  convertUsersOfConstantsToInstructions(constant, func, false);
5066 
5067  // The users iterator will get invalidated if we modify an element,
5068  // so we populate this vector of uses to alter each user on an
5069  // individual basis to emit its own load (rather than one load for
5070  // all).
5071  llvm::SmallVector<llvm::User *> userVec;
5072  for (llvm::User *user : mapData.OriginalValue[i]->users())
5073  userVec.push_back(user);
5074 
5075  for (llvm::User *user : userVec) {
5076  if (auto *insn = dyn_cast<llvm::Instruction>(user)) {
5077  if (insn->getFunction() == func) {
5078  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(insn->getDebugLoc());
5079  auto *load = builder.CreateLoad(mapData.BasePointers[i]->getType(),
5080  mapData.BasePointers[i]);
5081  load->moveBefore(insn->getIterator());
5082  user->replaceUsesOfWith(mapData.OriginalValue[i], load);
5083  }
5084  }
5085  }
5086  }
5087  }
5088 }
5089 
5090 // The createDeviceArgumentAccessor function generates
5091 // instructions for retrieving (acessing) kernel
5092 // arguments inside of the device kernel for use by
5093 // the kernel. This enables different semantics such as
5094 // the creation of temporary copies of data allowing
5095 // semantics like read-only/no host write back kernel
5096 // arguments.
5097 //
5098 // This currently implements a very light version of Clang's
5099 // EmitParmDecl's handling of direct argument handling as well
5100 // as a portion of the argument access generation based on
5101 // capture types found at the end of emitOutlinedFunctionPrologue
5102 // in Clang. The indirect path handling of EmitParmDecl's may be
5103 // required for future work, but a direct 1-to-1 copy doesn't seem
5104 // possible as the logic is rather scattered throughout Clang's
5105 // lowering and perhaps we wish to deviate slightly.
5106 //
5107 // \param mapData - A container containing vectors of information
5108 // corresponding to the input argument, which should have a
5109 // corresponding entry in the MapInfoData containers
5110 // OrigialValue's.
5111 // \param arg - This is the generated kernel function argument that
5112 // corresponds to the passed in input argument. We generated different
5113 // accesses of this Argument, based on capture type and other Input
5114 // related information.
5115 // \param input - This is the host side value that will be passed to
5116 // the kernel i.e. the kernel input, we rewrite all uses of this within
5117 // the kernel (as we generate the kernel body based on the target's region
5118 // which maintians references to the original input) to the retVal argument
5119 // apon exit of this function inside of the OMPIRBuilder. This interlinks
5120 // the kernel argument to future uses of it in the function providing
5121 // appropriate "glue" instructions inbetween.
5122 // \param retVal - This is the value that all uses of input inside of the
5123 // kernel will be re-written to, the goal of this function is to generate
5124 // an appropriate location for the kernel argument to be accessed from,
5125 // e.g. ByRef will result in a temporary allocation location and then
5126 // a store of the kernel argument into this allocated memory which
5127 // will then be loaded from, ByCopy will use the allocated memory
5128 // directly.
5129 static llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPoint
5130 createDeviceArgumentAccessor(MapInfoData &mapData, llvm::Argument &arg,
5131  llvm::Value *input, llvm::Value *&retVal,
5132  llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5133  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder &ompBuilder,
5134  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
5135  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPoint allocaIP,
5136  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPoint codeGenIP) {
5137  assert(ompBuilder.Config.isTargetDevice() &&
5138  "function only supported for target device codegen");
5139  builder.restoreIP(allocaIP);
5140 
5141  omp::VariableCaptureKind capture = omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByRef;
5142  LLVM::TypeToLLVMIRTranslator typeToLLVMIRTranslator(
5143  ompBuilder.M.getContext());
5144  unsigned alignmentValue = 0;
5145  // Find the associated MapInfoData entry for the current input
5146  for (size_t i = 0; i < mapData.MapClause.size(); ++i)
5147  if (mapData.OriginalValue[i] == input) {
5148  auto mapOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapData.MapClause[i]);
5149  capture = mapOp.getMapCaptureType();
5150  // Get information of alignment of mapped object
5151  alignmentValue = typeToLLVMIRTranslator.getPreferredAlignment(
5152  mapOp.getVarType(), ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout());
5153  break;
5154  }
5155 
5156  unsigned int allocaAS = ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout().getAllocaAddrSpace();
5157  unsigned int defaultAS =
5158  ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout().getProgramAddressSpace();
5159 
5160  // Create the alloca for the argument the current point.
5161  llvm::Value *v = builder.CreateAlloca(arg.getType(), allocaAS);
5162 
5163  if (allocaAS != defaultAS && arg.getType()->isPointerTy())
5164  v = builder.CreateAddrSpaceCast(v, builder.getPtrTy(defaultAS));
5165 
5166  builder.CreateStore(&arg, v);
5167 
5168  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
5169 
5170  switch (capture) {
5171  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByCopy: {
5172  retVal = v;
5173  break;
5174  }
5175  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::ByRef: {
5176  llvm::LoadInst *loadInst = builder.CreateAlignedLoad(
5177  v->getType(), v,
5178  ompBuilder.M.getDataLayout().getPrefTypeAlign(v->getType()));
5179  // CreateAlignedLoad function creates similar LLVM IR:
5180  // %res = load ptr, ptr %input, align 8
5181  // This LLVM IR does not contain information about alignment
5182  // of the loaded value. We need to add !align metadata to unblock
5183  // optimizer. The existence of the !align metadata on the instruction
5184  // tells the optimizer that the value loaded is known to be aligned to
5185  // a boundary specified by the integer value in the metadata node.
5186  // Example:
5187  // %res = load ptr, ptr %input, align 8, !align !align_md_node
5188  // ^ ^
5189  // | |
5190  // alignment of %input address |
5191  // |
5192  // alignment of %res object
5193  if (v->getType()->isPointerTy() && alignmentValue) {
5194  llvm::MDBuilder MDB(builder.getContext());
5195  loadInst->setMetadata(
5196  llvm::LLVMContext::MD_align,
5197  llvm::MDNode::get(builder.getContext(),
5198  MDB.createConstant(llvm::ConstantInt::get(
5199  llvm::Type::getInt64Ty(builder.getContext()),
5200  alignmentValue))));
5201  }
5202  retVal = loadInst;
5203 
5204  break;
5205  }
5206  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::This:
5207  case omp::VariableCaptureKind::VLAType:
5208  // TODO: Consider returning error to use standard reporting for
5209  // unimplemented features.
5210  assert(false && "Currently unsupported capture kind");
5211  break;
5212  }
5213 
5214  return builder.saveIP();
5215 }
5216 
5217 /// Follow uses of `host_eval`-defined block arguments of the given `omp.target`
5218 /// operation and populate output variables with their corresponding host value
5219 /// (i.e. operand evaluated outside of the target region), based on their uses
5220 /// inside of the target region.
5221 ///
5222 /// Loop bounds and steps are only optionally populated, if output vectors are
5223 /// provided.
5224 static void
5225 extractHostEvalClauses(omp::TargetOp targetOp, Value &numThreads,
5226  Value &numTeamsLower, Value &numTeamsUpper,
5227  Value &threadLimit,
5228  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *lowerBounds = nullptr,
5229  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *upperBounds = nullptr,
5230  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *steps = nullptr) {
5231  auto blockArgIface = llvm::cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(*targetOp);
5232  for (auto item : llvm::zip_equal(targetOp.getHostEvalVars(),
5233  blockArgIface.getHostEvalBlockArgs())) {
5234  Value hostEvalVar = std::get<0>(item), blockArg = std::get<1>(item);
5235 
5236  for (Operation *user : blockArg.getUsers()) {
5237  llvm::TypeSwitch<Operation *>(user)
5238  .Case([&](omp::TeamsOp teamsOp) {
5239  if (teamsOp.getNumTeamsLower() == blockArg)
5240  numTeamsLower = hostEvalVar;
5241  else if (teamsOp.getNumTeamsUpper() == blockArg)
5242  numTeamsUpper = hostEvalVar;
5243  else if (teamsOp.getThreadLimit() == blockArg)
5244  threadLimit = hostEvalVar;
5245  else
5246  llvm_unreachable("unsupported host_eval use");
5247  })
5248  .Case([&](omp::ParallelOp parallelOp) {
5249  if (parallelOp.getNumThreads() == blockArg)
5250  numThreads = hostEvalVar;
5251  else
5252  llvm_unreachable("unsupported host_eval use");
5253  })
5254  .Case([&](omp::LoopNestOp loopOp) {
5255  auto processBounds =
5256  [&](OperandRange opBounds,
5257  llvm::SmallVectorImpl<Value> *outBounds) -> bool {
5258  bool found = false;
5259  for (auto [i, lb] : llvm::enumerate(opBounds)) {
5260  if (lb == blockArg) {
5261  found = true;
5262  if (outBounds)
5263  (*outBounds)[i] = hostEvalVar;
5264  }
5265  }
5266  return found;
5267  };
5268  bool found =
5269  processBounds(loopOp.getLoopLowerBounds(), lowerBounds);
5270  found = processBounds(loopOp.getLoopUpperBounds(), upperBounds) ||
5271  found;
5272  found = processBounds(loopOp.getLoopSteps(), steps) || found;
5273  (void)found;
5274  assert(found && "unsupported host_eval use");
5275  })
5276  .Default([](Operation *) {
5277  llvm_unreachable("unsupported host_eval use");
5278  });
5279  }
5280  }
5281 }
5282 
5283 /// If \p op is of the given type parameter, return it casted to that type.
5284 /// Otherwise, if its immediate parent operation (or some other higher-level
5285 /// parent, if \p immediateParent is false) is of that type, return that parent
5286 /// casted to the given type.
5287 ///
5288 /// If \p op is \c null or neither it or its parent(s) are of the specified
5289 /// type, return a \c null operation.
5290 template <typename OpTy>
5291 static OpTy castOrGetParentOfType(Operation *op, bool immediateParent = false) {
5292  if (!op)
5293  return OpTy();
5294 
5295  if (OpTy casted = dyn_cast<OpTy>(op))
5296  return casted;
5297 
5298  if (immediateParent)
5299  return dyn_cast_if_present<OpTy>(op->getParentOp());
5300 
5301  return op->getParentOfType<OpTy>();
5302 }
5303 
5304 /// If the given \p value is defined by an \c llvm.mlir.constant operation and
5305 /// it is of an integer type, return its value.
5306 static std::optional<int64_t> extractConstInteger(Value value) {
5307  if (!value)
5308  return std::nullopt;
5309 
5310  if (auto constOp = value.getDefiningOp<LLVM::ConstantOp>())
5311  if (auto constAttr = dyn_cast<IntegerAttr>(constOp.getValue()))
5312  return constAttr.getInt();
5313 
5314  return std::nullopt;
5315 }
5316 
5317 static uint64_t getTypeByteSize(mlir::Type type, const DataLayout &dl) {
5318  uint64_t sizeInBits = dl.getTypeSizeInBits(type);
5319  uint64_t sizeInBytes = sizeInBits / 8;
5320  return sizeInBytes;
5321 }
5322 
5323 template <typename OpTy>
5324 static uint64_t getReductionDataSize(OpTy &op) {
5325  if (op.getNumReductionVars() > 0) {
5326  SmallVector<omp::DeclareReductionOp> reductions;
5327  collectReductionDecls(op, reductions);
5328 
5329  llvm::SmallVector<mlir::Type> members;
5330  members.reserve(reductions.size());
5331  for (omp::DeclareReductionOp &red : reductions)
5332  members.push_back(red.getType());
5333  Operation *opp = op.getOperation();
5334  auto structType = mlir::LLVM::LLVMStructType::getLiteral(
5335  opp->getContext(), members, /*isPacked=*/false);
5336  DataLayout dl = DataLayout(opp->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
5337  return getTypeByteSize(structType, dl);
5338  }
5339  return 0;
5340 }
5341 
5342 /// Populate default `MinTeams`, `MaxTeams` and `MaxThreads` to their default
5343 /// values as stated by the corresponding clauses, if constant.
5344 ///
5345 /// These default values must be set before the creation of the outlined LLVM
5346 /// function for the target region, so that they can be used to initialize the
5347 /// corresponding global `ConfigurationEnvironmentTy` structure.
5348 static void
5349 initTargetDefaultAttrs(omp::TargetOp targetOp, Operation *capturedOp,
5350  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelDefaultAttrs &attrs,
5351  bool isTargetDevice, bool isGPU) {
5352  // TODO: Handle constant 'if' clauses.
5353 
5354  Value numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper, threadLimit;
5355  if (!isTargetDevice) {
5356  extractHostEvalClauses(targetOp, numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper,
5357  threadLimit);
5358  } else {
5359  // In the target device, values for these clauses are not passed as
5360  // host_eval, but instead evaluated prior to entry to the region. This
5361  // ensures values are mapped and available inside of the target region.
5362  if (auto teamsOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>(capturedOp)) {
5363  numTeamsLower = teamsOp.getNumTeamsLower();
5364  numTeamsUpper = teamsOp.getNumTeamsUpper();
5365  threadLimit = teamsOp.getThreadLimit();
5366  }
5367 
5368  if (auto parallelOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::ParallelOp>(capturedOp))
5369  numThreads = parallelOp.getNumThreads();
5370  }
5371 
5372  // Handle clauses impacting the number of teams.
5373 
5374  int32_t minTeamsVal = 1, maxTeamsVal = -1;
5375  if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>(capturedOp)) {
5376  // TODO: Use `hostNumTeamsLower` to initialize `minTeamsVal`. For now, match
5377  // clang and set min and max to the same value.
5378  if (numTeamsUpper) {
5379  if (auto val = extractConstInteger(numTeamsUpper))
5380  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = *val;
5381  } else {
5382  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = 0;
5383  }
5384  } else if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::ParallelOp>(capturedOp,
5385  /*immediateParent=*/true) ||
5386  castOrGetParentOfType<omp::SimdOp>(capturedOp,
5387  /*immediateParent=*/true)) {
5388  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = 1;
5389  } else {
5390  minTeamsVal = maxTeamsVal = -1;
5391  }
5392 
5393  // Handle clauses impacting the number of threads.
5394 
5395  auto setMaxValueFromClause = [](Value clauseValue, int32_t &result) {
5396  if (!clauseValue)
5397  return;
5398 
5399  if (auto val = extractConstInteger(clauseValue))
5400  result = *val;
5401 
5402  // Found an applicable clause, so it's not undefined. Mark as unknown
5403  // because it's not constant.
5404  if (result < 0)
5405  result = 0;
5406  };
5407 
5408  // Extract 'thread_limit' clause from 'target' and 'teams' directives.
5409  int32_t targetThreadLimitVal = -1, teamsThreadLimitVal = -1;
5410  setMaxValueFromClause(targetOp.getThreadLimit(), targetThreadLimitVal);
5411  setMaxValueFromClause(threadLimit, teamsThreadLimitVal);
5412 
5413  // Extract 'max_threads' clause from 'parallel' or set to 1 if it's SIMD.
5414  int32_t maxThreadsVal = -1;
5415  if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::ParallelOp>(capturedOp))
5416  setMaxValueFromClause(numThreads, maxThreadsVal);
5417  else if (castOrGetParentOfType<omp::SimdOp>(capturedOp,
5418  /*immediateParent=*/true))
5419  maxThreadsVal = 1;
5420 
5421  // For max values, < 0 means unset, == 0 means set but unknown. Select the
5422  // minimum value between 'max_threads' and 'thread_limit' clauses that were
5423  // set.
5424  int32_t combinedMaxThreadsVal = targetThreadLimitVal;
5425  if (combinedMaxThreadsVal < 0 ||
5426  (teamsThreadLimitVal >= 0 && teamsThreadLimitVal < combinedMaxThreadsVal))
5427  combinedMaxThreadsVal = teamsThreadLimitVal;
5428 
5429  if (combinedMaxThreadsVal < 0 ||
5430  (maxThreadsVal >= 0 && maxThreadsVal < combinedMaxThreadsVal))
5431  combinedMaxThreadsVal = maxThreadsVal;
5432 
5433  int32_t reductionDataSize = 0;
5434  if (isGPU && capturedOp) {
5435  if (auto teamsOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::TeamsOp>(capturedOp))
5436  reductionDataSize = getReductionDataSize(teamsOp);
5437  }
5438 
5439  // Update kernel bounds structure for the `OpenMPIRBuilder` to use.
5440  omp::TargetRegionFlags kernelFlags = targetOp.getKernelExecFlags(capturedOp);
5441  assert(
5442  omp::bitEnumContainsAny(kernelFlags, omp::TargetRegionFlags::generic |
5443  omp::TargetRegionFlags::spmd) &&
5444  "invalid kernel flags");
5445  attrs.ExecFlags =
5446  omp::bitEnumContainsAny(kernelFlags, omp::TargetRegionFlags::generic)
5447  ? omp::bitEnumContainsAny(kernelFlags, omp::TargetRegionFlags::spmd)
5448  ? llvm::omp::OMP_TGT_EXEC_MODE_GENERIC_SPMD
5449  : llvm::omp::OMP_TGT_EXEC_MODE_GENERIC
5450  : llvm::omp::OMP_TGT_EXEC_MODE_SPMD;
5451  if (omp::bitEnumContainsAll(kernelFlags,
5452  omp::TargetRegionFlags::spmd |
5453  omp::TargetRegionFlags::no_loop) &&
5454  !omp::bitEnumContainsAny(kernelFlags, omp::TargetRegionFlags::generic))
5455  attrs.ExecFlags = llvm::omp::OMP_TGT_EXEC_MODE_SPMD_NO_LOOP;
5456 
5457  attrs.MinTeams = minTeamsVal;
5458  attrs.MaxTeams.front() = maxTeamsVal;
5459  attrs.MinThreads = 1;
5460  attrs.MaxThreads.front() = combinedMaxThreadsVal;
5461  attrs.ReductionDataSize = reductionDataSize;
5462  // TODO: Allow modified buffer length similar to
5463  // fopenmp-cuda-teams-reduction-recs-num flag in clang.
5464  if (attrs.ReductionDataSize != 0)
5465  attrs.ReductionBufferLength = 1024;
5466 }
5467 
5468 /// Gather LLVM runtime values for all clauses evaluated in the host that are
5469 /// passed to the kernel invocation.
5470 ///
5471 /// This function must be called only when compiling for the host. Also, it will
5472 /// only provide correct results if it's called after the body of \c targetOp
5473 /// has been fully generated.
5474 static void
5475 initTargetRuntimeAttrs(llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5476  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation,
5477  omp::TargetOp targetOp, Operation *capturedOp,
5478  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelRuntimeAttrs &attrs) {
5479  omp::LoopNestOp loopOp = castOrGetParentOfType<omp::LoopNestOp>(capturedOp);
5480  unsigned numLoops = loopOp ? loopOp.getNumLoops() : 0;
5481 
5482  Value numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper, teamsThreadLimit;
5483  llvm::SmallVector<Value> lowerBounds(numLoops), upperBounds(numLoops),
5484  steps(numLoops);
5485  extractHostEvalClauses(targetOp, numThreads, numTeamsLower, numTeamsUpper,
5486  teamsThreadLimit, &lowerBounds, &upperBounds, &steps);
5487 
5488  // TODO: Handle constant 'if' clauses.
5489  if (Value targetThreadLimit = targetOp.getThreadLimit())
5490  attrs.TargetThreadLimit.front() =
5491  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(targetThreadLimit);
5492 
5493  if (numTeamsLower)
5494  attrs.MinTeams = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(numTeamsLower);
5495 
5496  if (numTeamsUpper)
5497  attrs.MaxTeams.front() = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(numTeamsUpper);
5498 
5499  if (teamsThreadLimit)
5500  attrs.TeamsThreadLimit.front() =
5501  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(teamsThreadLimit);
5502 
5503  if (numThreads)
5504  attrs.MaxThreads = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(numThreads);
5505 
5506  if (omp::bitEnumContainsAny(targetOp.getKernelExecFlags(capturedOp),
5507  omp::TargetRegionFlags::trip_count)) {
5508  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
5509  attrs.LoopTripCount = nullptr;
5510 
5511  // To calculate the trip count, we multiply together the trip counts of
5512  // every collapsed canonical loop. We don't need to create the loop nests
5513  // here, since we're only interested in the trip count.
5514  for (auto [loopLower, loopUpper, loopStep] :
5515  llvm::zip_equal(lowerBounds, upperBounds, steps)) {
5516  llvm::Value *lowerBound = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(loopLower);
5517  llvm::Value *upperBound = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(loopUpper);
5518  llvm::Value *step = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(loopStep);
5519 
5520  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription loc(builder);
5521  llvm::Value *tripCount = ompBuilder->calculateCanonicalLoopTripCount(
5522  loc, lowerBound, upperBound, step, /*IsSigned=*/true,
5523  loopOp.getLoopInclusive());
5524 
5525  if (!attrs.LoopTripCount) {
5526  attrs.LoopTripCount = tripCount;
5527  continue;
5528  }
5529 
5530  // TODO: Enable UndefinedSanitizer to diagnose an overflow here.
5531  attrs.LoopTripCount = builder.CreateMul(attrs.LoopTripCount, tripCount,
5532  {}, /*HasNUW=*/true);
5533  }
5534  }
5535 }
5536 
5537 static LogicalResult
5538 convertOmpTarget(Operation &opInst, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5539  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
5540  auto targetOp = cast<omp::TargetOp>(opInst);
5541  // The current debug location already has the DISubprogram for the outlined
5542  // function that will be created for the target op. We save it here so that
5543  // we can set it on the outlined function.
5544  llvm::DebugLoc outlinedFnLoc = builder.getCurrentDebugLocation();
5545  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(opInst)))
5546  return failure();
5547 
5548  // During the handling of target op, we will generate instructions in the
5549  // parent function like call to the oulined function or branch to a new
5550  // BasicBlock. We set the debug location here to parent function so that those
5551  // get the correct debug locations. For outlined functions, the normal MLIR op
5552  // conversion will automatically pick the correct location.
5553  llvm::BasicBlock *parentBB = builder.GetInsertBlock();
5554  assert(parentBB && "No insert block is set for the builder");
5555  llvm::Function *parentLLVMFn = parentBB->getParent();
5556  assert(parentLLVMFn && "Parent Function must be valid");
5557  if (llvm::DISubprogram *SP = parentLLVMFn->getSubprogram())
5558  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(llvm::DILocation::get(
5559  parentLLVMFn->getContext(), outlinedFnLoc.getLine(),
5560  outlinedFnLoc.getCol(), SP, outlinedFnLoc.getInlinedAt()));
5561 
5562  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
5563  bool isTargetDevice = ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice();
5564  bool isGPU = ompBuilder->Config.isGPU();
5565 
5566  auto parentFn = opInst.getParentOfType<LLVM::LLVMFuncOp>();
5567  auto argIface = cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(opInst);
5568  auto &targetRegion = targetOp.getRegion();
5569  // Holds the private vars that have been mapped along with the block argument
5570  // that corresponds to the MapInfoOp corresponding to the private var in
5571  // question. So, for instance:
5572  //
5573  // %10 = omp.map.info var_ptr(%6#0 : !fir.ref<!fir.box<!fir.heap<i32>>>, ..)
5574  // omp.target map_entries(%10 -> %arg0) private(@box.privatizer %6#0-> %arg1)
5575  //
5576  // Then, %10 has been created so that the descriptor can be used by the
