5577  // privatizer @box.privatizer on the device side. Here we'd record {%6#0,
5578  // %arg0} in the mappedPrivateVars map.
5579  llvm::DenseMap<Value, Value> mappedPrivateVars;
5580  DataLayout dl = DataLayout(opInst.getParentOfType<ModuleOp>());
5581  SmallVector<Value> mapVars = targetOp.getMapVars();
5582  SmallVector<Value> hdaVars = targetOp.getHasDeviceAddrVars();
5583  ArrayRef<BlockArgument> mapBlockArgs = argIface.getMapBlockArgs();
5584  ArrayRef<BlockArgument> hdaBlockArgs = argIface.getHasDeviceAddrBlockArgs();
5585  llvm::Function *llvmOutlinedFn = nullptr;
5586 
5587  // TODO: It can also be false if a compile-time constant `false` IF clause is
5588  // specified.
5589  bool isOffloadEntry =
5590  isTargetDevice || !ompBuilder->Config.TargetTriples.empty();
5591 
5592  // For some private variables, the MapsForPrivatizedVariablesPass
5593  // creates MapInfoOp instances. Go through the private variables and
5594  // the mapped variables so that during codegeneration we are able
5595  // to quickly look up the corresponding map variable, if any for each
5596  // private variable.
5597  if (!targetOp.getPrivateVars().empty() && !targetOp.getMapVars().empty()) {
5598  OperandRange privateVars = targetOp.getPrivateVars();
5599  std::optional<ArrayAttr> privateSyms = targetOp.getPrivateSyms();
5600  std::optional<DenseI64ArrayAttr> privateMapIndices =
5601  targetOp.getPrivateMapsAttr();
5602 
5603  for (auto [privVarIdx, privVarSymPair] :
5604  llvm::enumerate(llvm::zip_equal(privateVars, *privateSyms))) {
5605  auto privVar = std::get<0>(privVarSymPair);
5606  auto privSym = std::get<1>(privVarSymPair);
5607 
5608  SymbolRefAttr privatizerName = llvm::cast<SymbolRefAttr>(privSym);
5609  omp::PrivateClauseOp privatizer =
5610  findPrivatizer(targetOp, privatizerName);
5611 
5612  if (!privatizer.needsMap())
5613  continue;
5614 
5615  mlir::Value mappedValue =
5616  targetOp.getMappedValueForPrivateVar(privVarIdx);
5617  assert(mappedValue && "Expected to find mapped value for a privatized "
5618  "variable that needs mapping");
5619 
5620  // The MapInfoOp defining the map var isn't really needed later.
5621  // So, we don't store it in any datastructure. Instead, we just
5622  // do some sanity checks on it right now.
5623  auto mapInfoOp = mappedValue.getDefiningOp<omp::MapInfoOp>();
5624  [[maybe_unused]] Type varType = mapInfoOp.getVarType();
5625 
5626  // Check #1: Check that the type of the private variable matches
5627  // the type of the variable being mapped.
5628  if (!isa<LLVM::LLVMPointerType>(privVar.getType()))
5629  assert(
5630  varType == privVar.getType() &&
5631  "Type of private var doesn't match the type of the mapped value");
5632 
5633  // Ok, only 1 sanity check for now.
5634  // Record the block argument corresponding to this mapvar.
5635  mappedPrivateVars.insert(
5636  {privVar,
5637  targetRegion.getArgument(argIface.getMapBlockArgsStart() +
5638  (*privateMapIndices)[privVarIdx])});
5639  }
5640  }
5641 
5642  using InsertPointTy = llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy;
5643  auto bodyCB = [&](InsertPointTy allocaIP, InsertPointTy codeGenIP)
5644  -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy {
5645  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPointGuard guard(builder);
5646  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(llvm::DebugLoc());
5647  // Forward target-cpu and target-features function attributes from the
5648  // original function to the new outlined function.
5649  llvm::Function *llvmParentFn =
5650  moduleTranslation.lookupFunction(parentFn.getName());
5651  llvmOutlinedFn = codeGenIP.getBlock()->getParent();
5652  assert(llvmParentFn && llvmOutlinedFn &&
5653  "Both parent and outlined functions must exist at this point");
5654 
5655  if (outlinedFnLoc && llvmParentFn->getSubprogram())
5656  llvmOutlinedFn->setSubprogram(outlinedFnLoc->getScope()->getSubprogram());
5657 
5658  if (auto attr = llvmParentFn->getFnAttribute("target-cpu");
5659  attr.isStringAttribute())
5660  llvmOutlinedFn->addFnAttr(attr);
5661 
5662  if (auto attr = llvmParentFn->getFnAttribute("target-features");
5663  attr.isStringAttribute())
5664  llvmOutlinedFn->addFnAttr(attr);
5665 
5666  for (auto [arg, mapOp] : llvm::zip_equal(mapBlockArgs, mapVars)) {
5667  auto mapInfoOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapOp.getDefiningOp());
5668  llvm::Value *mapOpValue =
5669  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(mapInfoOp.getVarPtr());
5670  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, mapOpValue);
5671  }
5672  for (auto [arg, mapOp] : llvm::zip_equal(hdaBlockArgs, hdaVars)) {
5673  auto mapInfoOp = cast<omp::MapInfoOp>(mapOp.getDefiningOp());
5674  llvm::Value *mapOpValue =
5675  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(mapInfoOp.getVarPtr());
5676  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, mapOpValue);
5677  }
5678 
5679  // Do privatization after moduleTranslation has already recorded
5680  // mapped values.
5681  PrivateVarsInfo privateVarsInfo(targetOp);
5682 
5683  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> afterAllocas =
5684  allocatePrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privateVarsInfo,
5685  allocaIP, &mappedPrivateVars);
5686 
5687  if (failed(handleError(afterAllocas, *targetOp)))
5688  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
5689 
5690  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
5691  if (handleError(initPrivateVars(builder, moduleTranslation, privateVarsInfo,
5692  &mappedPrivateVars),
5693  *targetOp)
5694  .failed())
5695  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
5696 
5697  if (failed(copyFirstPrivateVars(
5698  targetOp, builder, moduleTranslation, privateVarsInfo.mlirVars,
5699  privateVarsInfo.llvmVars, privateVarsInfo.privatizers,
5700  targetOp.getPrivateNeedsBarrier(), &mappedPrivateVars)))
5701  return llvm::make_error<PreviouslyReportedError>();
5702 
5703  SmallVector<Region *> privateCleanupRegions;
5704  llvm::transform(privateVarsInfo.privatizers,
5705  std::back_inserter(privateCleanupRegions),
5706  [](omp::PrivateClauseOp privatizer) {
5707  return &privatizer.getDeallocRegion();
5708  });
5709 
5710  llvm::Expected<llvm::BasicBlock *> exitBlock = convertOmpOpRegions(
5711  targetRegion, "omp.target", builder, moduleTranslation);
5712 
5713  if (!exitBlock)
5714  return exitBlock.takeError();
5715 
5716  builder.SetInsertPoint(*exitBlock);
5717  if (!privateCleanupRegions.empty()) {
5718  if (failed(inlineOmpRegionCleanup(
5719  privateCleanupRegions, privateVarsInfo.llvmVars,
5720  moduleTranslation, builder, "omp.targetop.private.cleanup",
5721  /*shouldLoadCleanupRegionArg=*/false))) {
5722  return llvm::createStringError(
5723  "failed to inline `dealloc` region of `omp.private` "
5724  "op in the target region");
5725  }
5726  return builder.saveIP();
5727  }
5728 
5729  return InsertPointTy(exitBlock.get(), exitBlock.get()->end());
5730  };
5731 
5732  StringRef parentName = parentFn.getName();
5733 
5734  llvm::TargetRegionEntryInfo entryInfo;
5735 
5736  getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(entryInfo, targetOp, parentName);
5737 
5738  MapInfoData mapData;
5739  collectMapDataFromMapOperands(mapData, mapVars, moduleTranslation, dl,
5740  builder, /*useDevPtrOperands=*/{},
5741  /*useDevAddrOperands=*/{}, hdaVars);
5742 
5743  MapInfosTy combinedInfos;
5744  auto genMapInfoCB =
5745  [&](llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy codeGenIP) -> MapInfosTy & {
5746  builder.restoreIP(codeGenIP);
5747  genMapInfos(builder, moduleTranslation, dl, combinedInfos, mapData, true);
5748  return combinedInfos;
5749  };
5750 
5751  auto argAccessorCB = [&](llvm::Argument &arg, llvm::Value *input,
5752  llvm::Value *&retVal, InsertPointTy allocaIP,
5753  InsertPointTy codeGenIP)
5754  -> llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy {
5755  llvm::IRBuilderBase::InsertPointGuard guard(builder);
5756  builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(llvm::DebugLoc());
5757  // We just return the unaltered argument for the host function
5758  // for now, some alterations may be required in the future to
5759  // keep host fallback functions working identically to the device
5760  // version (e.g. pass ByCopy values should be treated as such on
5761  // host and device, currently not always the case)
5762  if (!isTargetDevice) {
5763  retVal = cast<llvm::Value>(&arg);
5764  return codeGenIP;
5765  }
5766 
5767  return createDeviceArgumentAccessor(mapData, arg, input, retVal, builder,
5768  *ompBuilder, moduleTranslation,
5769  allocaIP, codeGenIP);
5770  };
5771 
5772  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelRuntimeAttrs runtimeAttrs;
5773  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetKernelDefaultAttrs defaultAttrs;
5774  Operation *targetCapturedOp = targetOp.getInnermostCapturedOmpOp();
5775  initTargetDefaultAttrs(targetOp, targetCapturedOp, defaultAttrs,
5776  isTargetDevice, isGPU);
5777 
5778  // Collect host-evaluated values needed to properly launch the kernel from the
5779  // host.
5780  if (!isTargetDevice)
5781  initTargetRuntimeAttrs(builder, moduleTranslation, targetOp,
5782  targetCapturedOp, runtimeAttrs);
5783 
5784  // Pass host-evaluated values as parameters to the kernel / host fallback,
5785  // except if they are constants. In any case, map the MLIR block argument to
5786  // the corresponding LLVM values.
5787  llvm::SmallVector<llvm::Value *, 4> kernelInput;
5788  SmallVector<Value> hostEvalVars = targetOp.getHostEvalVars();
5789  ArrayRef<BlockArgument> hostEvalBlockArgs = argIface.getHostEvalBlockArgs();
5790  for (auto [arg, var] : llvm::zip_equal(hostEvalBlockArgs, hostEvalVars)) {
5791  llvm::Value *value = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(var);
5792  moduleTranslation.mapValue(arg, value);
5793 
5794  if (!llvm::isa<llvm::Constant>(value))
5795  kernelInput.push_back(value);
5796  }
5797 
5798  for (size_t i = 0, e = mapData.OriginalValue.size(); i != e; ++i) {
5799  // declare target arguments are not passed to kernels as arguments
5800  // TODO: We currently do not handle cases where a member is explicitly
5801  // passed in as an argument, this will likley need to be handled in
5802  // the near future, rather than using IsAMember, it may be better to
5803  // test if the relevant BlockArg is used within the target region and
5804  // then use that as a basis for exclusion in the kernel inputs.
5805  if (!mapData.IsDeclareTarget[i] && !mapData.IsAMember[i])
5806  kernelInput.push_back(mapData.OriginalValue[i]);
5807  }
5808 
5809  SmallVector<llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::DependData> dds;
5810  buildDependData(targetOp.getDependKinds(), targetOp.getDependVars(),
5811  moduleTranslation, dds);
5812 
5813  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy allocaIP =
5814  findAllocaInsertPoint(builder, moduleTranslation);
5815  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::LocationDescription ompLoc(builder);
5816 
5817  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::TargetDataInfo info(
5818  /*RequiresDevicePointerInfo=*/false,
5819  /*SeparateBeginEndCalls=*/true);
5820 
5821  auto customMapperCB =
5822  [&](unsigned int i) -> llvm::Expected<llvm::Function *> {
5823  if (!combinedInfos.Mappers[i])
5824  return nullptr;
5825  info.HasMapper = true;
5826  return getOrCreateUserDefinedMapperFunc(combinedInfos.Mappers[i], builder,
5827  moduleTranslation);
5828  };
5829 
5830  llvm::Value *ifCond = nullptr;
5831  if (Value targetIfCond = targetOp.getIfExpr())
5832  ifCond = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(targetIfCond);
5833 
5834  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP =
5835  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->createTarget(
5836  ompLoc, isOffloadEntry, allocaIP, builder.saveIP(), info, entryInfo,
5837  defaultAttrs, runtimeAttrs, ifCond, kernelInput, genMapInfoCB, bodyCB,
5838  argAccessorCB, customMapperCB, dds, targetOp.getNowait());
5839 
5840  if (failed(handleError(afterIP, opInst)))
5841  return failure();
5842 
5843  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
5844 
5845  // Remap access operations to declare target reference pointers for the
5846  // device, essentially generating extra loadop's as necessary
5847  if (moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config.isTargetDevice())
5848  handleDeclareTargetMapVar(mapData, moduleTranslation, builder,
5849  llvmOutlinedFn);
5850 
5851  return success();
5852 }
5853 
5854 static LogicalResult
5855 convertDeclareTargetAttr(Operation *op, mlir::omp::DeclareTargetAttr attribute,
5856  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
5857  // Amend omp.declare_target by deleting the IR of the outlined functions
5858  // created for target regions. They cannot be filtered out from MLIR earlier
5859  // because the omp.target operation inside must be translated to LLVM, but
5860  // the wrapper functions themselves must not remain at the end of the
5861  // process. We know that functions where omp.declare_target does not match
5862  // omp.is_target_device at this stage can only be wrapper functions because
5863  // those that aren't are removed earlier as an MLIR transformation pass.
5864  if (FunctionOpInterface funcOp = dyn_cast<FunctionOpInterface>(op)) {
5865  if (auto offloadMod = dyn_cast<omp::OffloadModuleInterface>(
5866  op->getParentOfType<ModuleOp>().getOperation())) {
5867  if (!offloadMod.getIsTargetDevice())
5868  return success();
5869 
5870  omp::DeclareTargetDeviceType declareType =
5871  attribute.getDeviceType().getValue();
5872 
5873  if (declareType == omp::DeclareTargetDeviceType::host) {
5874  llvm::Function *llvmFunc =
5875  moduleTranslation.lookupFunction(funcOp.getName());
5876  llvmFunc->dropAllReferences();
5877  llvmFunc->eraseFromParent();
5878  }
5879  }
5880  return success();
5881  }
5882 
5883  if (LLVM::GlobalOp gOp = dyn_cast<LLVM::GlobalOp>(op)) {
5884  llvm::Module *llvmModule = moduleTranslation.getLLVMModule();
5885  if (auto *gVal = llvmModule->getNamedValue(gOp.getSymName())) {
5886  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
5887  bool isDeclaration = gOp.isDeclaration();
5888  bool isExternallyVisible =
5889  gOp.getVisibility() != mlir::SymbolTable::Visibility::Private;
5890  auto loc = op->getLoc()->findInstanceOf<FileLineColLoc>();
5891  llvm::StringRef mangledName = gOp.getSymName();
5892  auto captureClause =
5893  convertToCaptureClauseKind(attribute.getCaptureClause().getValue());
5894  auto deviceClause =
5895  convertToDeviceClauseKind(attribute.getDeviceType().getValue());
5896  // unused for MLIR at the moment, required in Clang for book
5897  // keeping
5898  std::vector<llvm::GlobalVariable *> generatedRefs;
5899 
5900  std::vector<llvm::Triple> targetTriple;
5901  auto targetTripleAttr = dyn_cast_or_null<mlir::StringAttr>(
5902  op->getParentOfType<mlir::ModuleOp>()->getAttr(
5903  LLVM::LLVMDialect::getTargetTripleAttrName()));
5904  if (targetTripleAttr)
5905  targetTriple.emplace_back(targetTripleAttr.data());
5906 
5907  auto fileInfoCallBack = [&loc]() {
5908  std::string filename = "";
5909  std::uint64_t lineNo = 0;
5910 
5911  if (loc) {
5912  filename = loc.getFilename().str();
5913  lineNo = loc.getLine();
5914  }
5915 
5916  return std::pair<std::string, std::uint64_t>(llvm::StringRef(filename),
5917  lineNo);
5918  };
5919 
5920  auto vfs = llvm::vfs::getRealFileSystem();
5921 
5922  ompBuilder->registerTargetGlobalVariable(
5923  captureClause, deviceClause, isDeclaration, isExternallyVisible,
5924  ompBuilder->getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(fileInfoCallBack, *vfs),
5925  mangledName, generatedRefs, /*OpenMPSimd*/ false, targetTriple,
5926  /*GlobalInitializer*/ nullptr, /*VariableLinkage*/ nullptr,
5927  gVal->getType(), gVal);
5928 
5929  if (ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice() &&
5930  (attribute.getCaptureClause().getValue() !=
5931  mlir::omp::DeclareTargetCaptureClause::to ||
5932  ompBuilder->Config.hasRequiresUnifiedSharedMemory())) {
5933  ompBuilder->getAddrOfDeclareTargetVar(
5934  captureClause, deviceClause, isDeclaration, isExternallyVisible,
5935  ompBuilder->getTargetEntryUniqueInfo(fileInfoCallBack, *vfs),
5936  mangledName, generatedRefs, /*OpenMPSimd*/ false, targetTriple,
5937  gVal->getType(), /*GlobalInitializer*/ nullptr,
5938  /*VariableLinkage*/ nullptr);
5939  }
5940  }
5941  }
5942 
5943  return success();
5944 }
5945 
5946 // Returns true if the operation is inside a TargetOp or
5947 // is part of a declare target function.
5948 static bool isTargetDeviceOp(Operation *op) {
5949  // Assumes no reverse offloading
5950  if (op->getParentOfType<omp::TargetOp>())
5951  return true;
5952 
5953  // Certain operations return results, and whether utilised in host or
5954  // target there is a chance an LLVM Dialect operation depends on it
5955  // by taking it in as an operand, so we must always lower these in
5956  // some manner or result in an ICE (whether they end up in a no-op
5957  // or otherwise).
5958  if (mlir::isa<omp::ThreadprivateOp>(op))
5959  return true;
5960 
5961  if (mlir::isa<omp::TargetAllocMemOp>(op) ||
5962  mlir::isa<omp::TargetFreeMemOp>(op))
5963  return true;
5964 
5965  if (auto parentFn = op->getParentOfType<LLVM::LLVMFuncOp>())
5966  if (auto declareTargetIface =
5967  llvm::dyn_cast<mlir::omp::DeclareTargetInterface>(
5968  parentFn.getOperation()))
5969  if (declareTargetIface.isDeclareTarget() &&
5970  declareTargetIface.getDeclareTargetDeviceType() !=
5971  mlir::omp::DeclareTargetDeviceType::host)
5972  return true;
5973 
5974  return false;
5975 }
5976 
5977 static llvm::Function *getOmpTargetAlloc(llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5978  llvm::Module *llvmModule) {
5979  llvm::Type *i64Ty = builder.getInt64Ty();
5980  llvm::Type *i32Ty = builder.getInt32Ty();
5981  llvm::Type *returnType = builder.getPtrTy(0);
5982  llvm::FunctionType *fnType =
5983  llvm::FunctionType::get(returnType, {i64Ty, i32Ty}, false);
5984  llvm::Function *func = cast<llvm::Function>(
5985  llvmModule->getOrInsertFunction("omp_target_alloc", fnType).getCallee());
5986  return func;
5987 }
5988 
5989 static LogicalResult
5990 convertTargetAllocMemOp(Operation &opInst, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
5991  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
5992  auto allocMemOp = cast<omp::TargetAllocMemOp>(opInst);
5993  if (!allocMemOp)
5994  return failure();
5995 
5996  // Get "omp_target_alloc" function
5997  llvm::Module *llvmModule = moduleTranslation.getLLVMModule();
5998  llvm::Function *ompTargetAllocFunc = getOmpTargetAlloc(builder, llvmModule);
5999  // Get the corresponding device value in llvm
6000  mlir::Value deviceNum = allocMemOp.getDevice();
6001  llvm::Value *llvmDeviceNum = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(deviceNum);
6002  // Get the allocation size.
6003  llvm::DataLayout dataLayout = llvmModule->getDataLayout();
6004  mlir::Type heapTy = allocMemOp.getAllocatedType();
6005  llvm::Type *llvmHeapTy = moduleTranslation.convertType(heapTy);
6006  llvm::TypeSize typeSize = dataLayout.getTypeStoreSize(llvmHeapTy);
6007  llvm::Value *allocSize = builder.getInt64(typeSize.getFixedValue());
6008  for (auto typeParam : allocMemOp.getTypeparams())
6009  allocSize =
6010  builder.CreateMul(allocSize, moduleTranslation.lookupValue(typeParam));
6011  // Create call to "omp_target_alloc" with the args as translated llvm values.
6012  llvm::CallInst *call =
6013  builder.CreateCall(ompTargetAllocFunc, {allocSize, llvmDeviceNum});
6014  llvm::Value *resultI64 = builder.CreatePtrToInt(call, builder.getInt64Ty());
6015 
6016  // Map the result
6017  moduleTranslation.mapValue(allocMemOp.getResult(), resultI64);
6018  return success();
6019 }
6020 
6021 static llvm::Function *getOmpTargetFree(llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6022  llvm::Module *llvmModule) {
6023  llvm::Type *ptrTy = builder.getPtrTy(0);
6024  llvm::Type *i32Ty = builder.getInt32Ty();
6025  llvm::Type *voidTy = builder.getVoidTy();
6026  llvm::FunctionType *fnType =
6027  llvm::FunctionType::get(voidTy, {ptrTy, i32Ty}, false);
6028  llvm::Function *func = dyn_cast<llvm::Function>(
6029  llvmModule->getOrInsertFunction("omp_target_free", fnType).getCallee());
6030  return func;
6031 }
6032 
6033 static LogicalResult
6034 convertTargetFreeMemOp(Operation &opInst, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6035  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
6036  auto freeMemOp = cast<omp::TargetFreeMemOp>(opInst);
6037  if (!freeMemOp)
6038  return failure();
6039 
6040  // Get "omp_target_free" function
6041  llvm::Module *llvmModule = moduleTranslation.getLLVMModule();
6042  llvm::Function *ompTragetFreeFunc = getOmpTargetFree(builder, llvmModule);
6043  // Get the corresponding device value in llvm
6044  mlir::Value deviceNum = freeMemOp.getDevice();
6045  llvm::Value *llvmDeviceNum = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(deviceNum);
6046  // Get the corresponding heapref value in llvm
6047  mlir::Value heapref = freeMemOp.getHeapref();
6048  llvm::Value *llvmHeapref = moduleTranslation.lookupValue(heapref);
6049  // Convert heapref int to ptr and call "omp_target_free"
6050  llvm::Value *intToPtr =
6051  builder.CreateIntToPtr(llvmHeapref, builder.getPtrTy(0));
6052  builder.CreateCall(ompTragetFreeFunc, {intToPtr, llvmDeviceNum});
6053  return success();
6054 }
6055 
6056 /// Given an OpenMP MLIR operation, create the corresponding LLVM IR (including
6057 /// OpenMP runtime calls).
6058 static LogicalResult
6059 convertHostOrTargetOperation(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6060  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
6061  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
6062 
6063  // For each loop, introduce one stack frame to hold loop information. Ensure
6064  // this is only done for the outermost loop wrapper to prevent introducing
6065  // multiple stack frames for a single loop. Initially set to null, the loop
6066  // information structure is initialized during translation of the nested
6067  // omp.loop_nest operation, making it available to translation of all loop
6068  // wrappers after their body has been successfully translated.
6069  bool isOutermostLoopWrapper =
6070  isa_and_present<omp::LoopWrapperInterface>(op) &&
6071  !dyn_cast_if_present<omp::LoopWrapperInterface>(op->getParentOp());
6072 
6073  if (isOutermostLoopWrapper)
6074  moduleTranslation.stackPush<OpenMPLoopInfoStackFrame>();
6075 
6076  auto result =
6077  llvm::TypeSwitch<Operation *, LogicalResult>(op)
6078  .Case([&](omp::BarrierOp op) -> LogicalResult {
6079  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*op)))
6080  return failure();
6081 
6082  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointOrErrorTy afterIP =
6083  ompBuilder->createBarrier(builder.saveIP(),
6084  llvm::omp::OMPD_barrier);
6085  LogicalResult res = handleError(afterIP, *op);
6086  if (res.succeeded()) {
6087  // If the barrier generated a cancellation check, the insertion
6088  // point might now need to be changed to a new continuation block
6089  builder.restoreIP(*afterIP);
6090  }
6091  return res;
6092  })
6093  .Case([&](omp::TaskyieldOp op) {
6094  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*op)))
6095  return failure();
6096 
6097  ompBuilder->createTaskyield(builder.saveIP());
6098  return success();
6099  })
6100  .Case([&](omp::FlushOp op) {
6101  if (failed(checkImplementationStatus(*op)))
6102  return failure();
6103 
6104  // No support in Openmp runtime function (__kmpc_flush) to accept
6105  // the argument list.
6106  // OpenMP standard states the following:
6107  // "An implementation may implement a flush with a list by ignoring
6108  // the list, and treating it the same as a flush without a list."
6109  //
6110  // The argument list is discarded so that, flush with a list is
6111  // treated same as a flush without a list.
6112  ompBuilder->createFlush(builder.saveIP());
6113  return success();
6114  })
6115  .Case([&](omp::ParallelOp op) {
6116  return convertOmpParallel(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6117  })
6118  .Case([&](omp::MaskedOp) {
6119  return convertOmpMasked(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6120  })
6121  .Case([&](omp::MasterOp) {
6122  return convertOmpMaster(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6123  })
6124  .Case([&](omp::CriticalOp) {
6125  return convertOmpCritical(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6126  })
6127  .Case([&](omp::OrderedRegionOp) {
6128  return convertOmpOrderedRegion(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6129  })
6130  .Case([&](omp::OrderedOp) {
6131  return convertOmpOrdered(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6132  })
6133  .Case([&](omp::WsloopOp) {
6134  return convertOmpWsloop(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6135  })
6136  .Case([&](omp::SimdOp) {
6137  return convertOmpSimd(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6138  })
6139  .Case([&](omp::AtomicReadOp) {
6140  return convertOmpAtomicRead(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6141  })
6142  .Case([&](omp::AtomicWriteOp) {
6143  return convertOmpAtomicWrite(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6144  })
6145  .Case([&](omp::AtomicUpdateOp op) {
6146  return convertOmpAtomicUpdate(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6147  })
6148  .Case([&](omp::AtomicCaptureOp op) {
6149  return convertOmpAtomicCapture(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6150  })
6151  .Case([&](omp::CancelOp op) {
6152  return convertOmpCancel(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6153  })
6154  .Case([&](omp::CancellationPointOp op) {
6155  return convertOmpCancellationPoint(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6156  })
6157  .Case([&](omp::SectionsOp) {
6158  return convertOmpSections(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6159  })
6160  .Case([&](omp::SingleOp op) {
6161  return convertOmpSingle(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6162  })
6163  .Case([&](omp::TeamsOp op) {
6164  return convertOmpTeams(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6165  })
6166  .Case([&](omp::TaskOp op) {
6167  return convertOmpTaskOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6168  })
6169  .Case([&](omp::TaskgroupOp op) {
6170  return convertOmpTaskgroupOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6171  })
6172  .Case([&](omp::TaskwaitOp op) {
6173  return convertOmpTaskwaitOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6174  })
6175  .Case<omp::YieldOp, omp::TerminatorOp, omp::DeclareMapperOp,
6176  omp::DeclareMapperInfoOp, omp::DeclareReductionOp,
6177  omp::CriticalDeclareOp>([](auto op) {
6178  // `yield` and `terminator` can be just omitted. The block structure
6179  // was created in the region that handles their parent operation.
6180  // `declare_reduction` will be used by reductions and is not
6181  // converted directly, skip it.
6182  // `declare_mapper` and `declare_mapper.info` are handled whenever
6183  // they are referred to through a `map` clause.
6184  // `critical.declare` is only used to declare names of critical
6185  // sections which will be used by `critical` ops and hence can be
6186  // ignored for lowering. The OpenMP IRBuilder will create unique
6187  // name for critical section names.
6188  return success();
6189  })
6190  .Case([&](omp::ThreadprivateOp) {
6191  return convertOmpThreadprivate(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6192  })
6193  .Case<omp::TargetDataOp, omp::TargetEnterDataOp,
6194  omp::TargetExitDataOp, omp::TargetUpdateOp>([&](auto op) {
6195  return convertOmpTargetData(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6196  })
6197  .Case([&](omp::TargetOp) {
6198  return convertOmpTarget(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6199  })
6200  .Case([&](omp::DistributeOp) {
6201  return convertOmpDistribute(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6202  })
6203  .Case([&](omp::LoopNestOp) {
6204  return convertOmpLoopNest(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6205  })
6206  .Case<omp::MapInfoOp, omp::MapBoundsOp, omp::PrivateClauseOp>(
6207  [&](auto op) {
6208  // No-op, should be handled by relevant owning operations e.g.
6209  // TargetOp, TargetEnterDataOp, TargetExitDataOp, TargetDataOp
6210  // etc. and then discarded
6211  return success();
6212  })
6213  .Case([&](omp::NewCliOp op) {
6214  // Meta-operation: Doesn't do anything by itself, but used to
6215  // identify a loop.
6216  return success();
6217  })
6218  .Case([&](omp::CanonicalLoopOp op) {
6219  return convertOmpCanonicalLoopOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6220  })
6221  .Case([&](omp::UnrollHeuristicOp op) {
6222  // FIXME: Handling omp.unroll_heuristic as an executable requires
6223  // that the generator (e.g. omp.canonical_loop) has been seen first.
6224  // For construct that require all codegen to occur inside a callback
6225  // (e.g. OpenMPIRBilder::createParallel), all codegen of that
6226  // contained region including their transformations must occur at
6227  // the omp.canonical_loop.
6228  return applyUnrollHeuristic(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6229  })
6230  .Case([&](omp::TargetAllocMemOp) {
6231  return convertTargetAllocMemOp(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6232  })
6233  .Case([&](omp::TargetFreeMemOp) {
6234  return convertTargetFreeMemOp(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6235  })
6236  .Default([&](Operation *inst) {
6237  return inst->emitError()
6238  << "not yet implemented: " << inst->getName();
6239  });
6240 
6241  if (isOutermostLoopWrapper)
6242  moduleTranslation.stackPop();
6243 
6244  return result;
6245 }
6246 
6247 static LogicalResult
6248 convertTargetDeviceOp(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6249  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
6250  return convertHostOrTargetOperation(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6251 }
6252 
6253 static LogicalResult
6254 convertTargetOpsInNest(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6255  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) {
6256  if (isa<omp::TargetOp>(op))
6257  return convertOmpTarget(*op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6258  if (isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(op))
6259  return convertOmpTargetData(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6260  bool interrupted =
6261  op->walk<WalkOrder::PreOrder>([&](Operation *oper) {
6262  if (isa<omp::TargetOp>(oper)) {
6263  if (failed(convertOmpTarget(*oper, builder, moduleTranslation)))
6264  return WalkResult::interrupt();
6265  return WalkResult::skip();
6266  }
6267  if (isa<omp::TargetDataOp>(oper)) {
6268  if (failed(convertOmpTargetData(oper, builder, moduleTranslation)))
6269  return WalkResult::interrupt();
6270  return WalkResult::skip();
6271  }
6272 
6273  // Non-target ops might nest target-related ops, therefore, we
6274  // translate them as non-OpenMP scopes. Translating them is needed by
6275  // nested target-related ops since they might need LLVM values defined
6276  // in their parent non-target ops.
6277  if (isa<omp::OpenMPDialect>(oper->getDialect()) &&
6278  oper->getParentOfType<LLVM::LLVMFuncOp>() &&
6279  !oper->getRegions().empty()) {
6280  if (auto blockArgsIface =
6281  dyn_cast<omp::BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface>(oper))
6282  forwardArgs(moduleTranslation, blockArgsIface);
6283  else {
6284  // Here we map entry block arguments of
6285  // non-BlockArgOpenMPOpInterface ops if they can be encountered
6286  // inside of a function and they define any of these arguments.
6287  if (isa<mlir::omp::AtomicUpdateOp>(oper))
6288  for (auto [operand, arg] :
6289  llvm::zip_equal(oper->getOperands(),
6290  oper->getRegion(0).getArguments())) {
6291  moduleTranslation.mapValue(
6292  arg, builder.CreateLoad(
6293  moduleTranslation.convertType(arg.getType()),
6294  moduleTranslation.lookupValue(operand)));
6295  }
6296  }
6297 
6298  if (auto loopNest = dyn_cast<omp::LoopNestOp>(oper)) {
6299  assert(builder.GetInsertBlock() &&
6300  "No insert block is set for the builder");
6301  for (auto iv : loopNest.getIVs()) {
6302  // Map iv to an undefined value just to keep the IR validity.
6303  moduleTranslation.mapValue(
6304  iv, llvm::PoisonValue::get(
6305  moduleTranslation.convertType(iv.getType())));
6306  }
6307  }
6308 
6309  for (Region &region : oper->getRegions()) {
6310  // Regions are fake in the sense that they are not a truthful
6311  // translation of the OpenMP construct being converted (e.g. no
6312  // OpenMP runtime calls will be generated). We just need this to
6313  // prepare the kernel invocation args.
6314  SmallVector<llvm::PHINode *> phis;
6315  auto result = convertOmpOpRegions(
6316  region, oper->getName().getStringRef().str() + ".fake.region",
6317  builder, moduleTranslation, &phis);
6318  if (failed(handleError(result, *oper)))
6319  return WalkResult::interrupt();
6320 
6321  builder.SetInsertPoint(result.get(), result.get()->end());
6322  }
6323 
6324  return WalkResult::skip();
6325  }
6326 
6327  return WalkResult::advance();
6328  }).wasInterrupted();
6329  return failure(interrupted);
6330 }
6331 
6332 namespace {
6333 
6334 /// Implementation of the dialect interface that converts operations belonging
6335 /// to the OpenMP dialect to LLVM IR.
6336 class OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface
6337  : public LLVMTranslationDialectInterface {
6338 public:
6339  using LLVMTranslationDialectInterface::LLVMTranslationDialectInterface;
6340 
6341  /// Translates the given operation to LLVM IR using the provided IR builder
6342  /// and saving the state in `moduleTranslation`.
6343  LogicalResult
6344  convertOperation(Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6345  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const final;
6346 
6347  /// Given an OpenMP MLIR attribute, create the corresponding LLVM-IR,
6348  /// runtime calls, or operation amendments
6349  LogicalResult
6350  amendOperation(Operation *op, ArrayRef<llvm::Instruction *> instructions,
6351  NamedAttribute attribute,
6352  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const final;
6353 };
6354 
6355 } // namespace
6356 
6357 LogicalResult OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface::amendOperation(
6358  Operation *op, ArrayRef<llvm::Instruction *> instructions,
6359  NamedAttribute attribute,
6360  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const {
6361  return llvm::StringSwitch<llvm::function_ref<LogicalResult(Attribute)>>(
6362  attribute.getName())
6363  .Case("omp.is_target_device",
6364  [&](Attribute attr) {
6365  if (auto deviceAttr = dyn_cast<BoolAttr>(attr)) {
6366  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6367  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6368  config.setIsTargetDevice(deviceAttr.getValue());
6369  return success();
6370  }
6371  return failure();
6372  })
6373  .Case("omp.is_gpu",
6374  [&](Attribute attr) {
6375  if (auto gpuAttr = dyn_cast<BoolAttr>(attr)) {
6376  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6377  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6378  config.setIsGPU(gpuAttr.getValue());
6379  return success();
6380  }
6381  return failure();
6382  })
6383  .Case("omp.host_ir_filepath",
6384  [&](Attribute attr) {
6385  if (auto filepathAttr = dyn_cast<StringAttr>(attr)) {
6386  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder =
6387  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
6388  auto VFS = llvm::vfs::getRealFileSystem();
6389  ompBuilder->loadOffloadInfoMetadata(*VFS,
6390  filepathAttr.getValue());
6391  return success();
6392  }
6393  return failure();
6394  })
6395  .Case("omp.flags",
6396  [&](Attribute attr) {
6397  if (auto rtlAttr = dyn_cast<omp::FlagsAttr>(attr))
6398  return convertFlagsAttr(op, rtlAttr, moduleTranslation);
6399  return failure();
6400  })
6401  .Case("omp.version",
6402  [&](Attribute attr) {
6403  if (auto versionAttr = dyn_cast<omp::VersionAttr>(attr)) {
6404  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder =
6405  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
6406  ompBuilder->M.addModuleFlag(llvm::Module::Max, "openmp",
6407  versionAttr.getVersion());
6408  return success();
6409  }
6410  return failure();
6411  })
6412  .Case("omp.declare_target",
6413  [&](Attribute attr) {
6414  if (auto declareTargetAttr =
6415  dyn_cast<omp::DeclareTargetAttr>(attr))
6416  return convertDeclareTargetAttr(op, declareTargetAttr,
6417  moduleTranslation);
6418  return failure();
6419  })
6420  .Case("omp.requires",
6421  [&](Attribute attr) {
6422  if (auto requiresAttr = dyn_cast<omp::ClauseRequiresAttr>(attr)) {
6423  using Requires = omp::ClauseRequires;
6424  Requires flags = requiresAttr.getValue();
6425  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6426  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6427  config.setHasRequiresReverseOffload(
6428  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::reverse_offload));
6429  config.setHasRequiresUnifiedAddress(
6430  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::unified_address));
6431  config.setHasRequiresUnifiedSharedMemory(
6432  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::unified_shared_memory));
6433  config.setHasRequiresDynamicAllocators(
6434  bitEnumContainsAll(flags, Requires::dynamic_allocators));
6435  return success();
6436  }
6437  return failure();
6438  })
6439  .Case("omp.target_triples",
6440  [&](Attribute attr) {
6441  if (auto triplesAttr = dyn_cast<ArrayAttr>(attr)) {
6442  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilderConfig &config =
6443  moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder()->Config;
6444  config.TargetTriples.clear();
6445  config.TargetTriples.reserve(triplesAttr.size());
6446  for (Attribute tripleAttr : triplesAttr) {
6447  if (auto tripleStrAttr = dyn_cast<StringAttr>(tripleAttr))
6448  config.TargetTriples.emplace_back(tripleStrAttr.getValue());
6449  else
6450  return failure();
6451  }
6452  return success();
6453  }
6454  return failure();
6455  })
6456  .Default([](Attribute) {
6457  // Fall through for omp attributes that do not require lowering.
6458  return success();
6459  })(attribute.getValue());
6460 
6461  return failure();
6462 }
6463 
6464 /// Given an OpenMP MLIR operation, create the corresponding LLVM IR
6465 /// (including OpenMP runtime calls).
6466 LogicalResult OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface::convertOperation(
6467  Operation *op, llvm::IRBuilderBase &builder,
6468  LLVM::ModuleTranslation &moduleTranslation) const {
6469 
6470  llvm::OpenMPIRBuilder *ompBuilder = moduleTranslation.getOpenMPBuilder();
6471  if (ompBuilder->Config.isTargetDevice()) {
6472  if (isTargetDeviceOp(op)) {
6473  return convertTargetDeviceOp(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6474  }
6475  return convertTargetOpsInNest(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6476  }
6477  return convertHostOrTargetOperation(op, builder, moduleTranslation);
6478 }
6479 
6480 void mlir::registerOpenMPDialectTranslation(DialectRegistry &registry) {
6481  registry.insert<omp::OpenMPDialect>();
6482  registry.addExtension(+[](MLIRContext *ctx, omp::OpenMPDialect *dialect) {
6483  dialect->addInterfaces<OpenMPDialectLLVMIRTranslationInterface>();
6484  });
6485 }
6486 
6487 void mlir::registerOpenMPDialectTranslation(MLIRContext &context) {
6488  DialectRegistry registry;
6489  registerOpenMPDialectTranslation(registry);
6490  context.appendDialectRegistry(registry);
6491 }
